en: Terry Branstad, the U.S. ambassador to China and the former longtime governor of Iowa, a major exporter of agricultural goods to China, said Beijing had hurt American workers, farmers and businesses.

zhs: 布兰斯塔德在周日出版的《得梅因纪事报》上发表的一篇评论文章中写道，中国“正通过在我们自己的自由媒体上刊登政治宣传广告，加大欺凌的力度”。
en: China, Branstad wrote in an opinion piece in Sunday's Des Moines Register, "is now doubling down on that bullying by running propaganda ads in our own free press."

zhs: “在政治宣传方面，中国政府正在利用美国珍视的言论自由和新闻自由的传统，在《得梅因纪事报》上刊登付费广告”，布兰斯塔德写到。
en: "In disseminating its propaganda, China's government is availing itself of America's cherished tradition of free speech and a free press by placing a paid advertisement in the Des Moines Register," Branstad wrote.

zhs: “相比之下，你很少会在北京街头的书报摊上看到反对的声音，也无法看到中国人民对中国令人担忧的经济发展轨迹所持不同意见的真实反映，因为媒体处于中国共产党严格的监控之下”，他写到。
en: "In contrast, at the newsstand down the street here in Beijing, you will find limited dissenting voices and will not see any true reflection of the disparate opinions that the Chinese people may have on China's troubling economic trajectory, given that media is under the firm thumb of the Chinese Communist Party," he wrote.

zhs: 他补充到，“中国最著名的报纸甚至拒绝出版他的文章”，但他没有说明是哪家报纸。
en: He added that "one of China's most prominent newspapers dodged the offer to publish" his article, although he did not say which newspaper.

zhs: 分析人士警告称，共和党在中期之前离间女性选民将导致卡瓦诺溃败
en: Republicans Alienating Women Voters Ahead of Midterms With Kavanaugh Debacle, Analysts Warn

zhs: 对于面临多项性侵指控的最高法院候选人布雷特·卡瓦诺 (Brett Kavanaugh)，多位共和党领导人坚持支持并为其辩护，分析人士警告称，在即将到来的中期选举中，他们将面临强烈的反对，尤其是女性的反对。
en: As many top Republicans stand-by and defend Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh in the face of several allegations of sexual assault, analyst have warned they will see a backlash, particularly from women, during the upcoming midterm elections.

zhs: 这一事件引发的情绪十分高涨，记录在案的大多数共和党人已经表明他们想获得选票走下去。
en: The emotions surrounding this have been extremely high, and most Republicans are on record already showing they wanted to go forward with a vote.

zhs: 在周六发表的一篇文章中，雪城大学麦斯威尔学院的格兰特·赖尔 (Grant Reeher) 教授向《国会山报》透露称，“这些事情不可能有回头路”。
en: Those things can't be walked back," Grant Reeher, a professor of political science at Syracuse University's Maxwell School told The Hill for an article published Saturday.

zhs: 赖尔表示，他怀疑参议员杰夫·弗雷克 (Jeff Flake)（亚利桑那州共和党人士）在紧急关头奋力争取联邦调查局 (FBI) 的调查将足以安抚选民们的愤怒情绪。
en: Reeher said he doubts Senator Jeff Flake's (R-Arizona) last-minute push for an FBI investigation will be enough to placate angry voters.

zhs: 据华盛顿特区报纸报道，进步组织 MoveOn 的高级顾问兼国家发言人卡琳·让-皮埃尔 (Karine Jean-Pierre) 于周五表示，“妇女们永远都不会忘记过去发生的事情 - 明天无法忘记，整个 11 月份都无法忘记”。
en: "Women are not going to forget what happened yesterday - they are not going to forget it tomorrow and not in November," Karine Jean-Pierre, a senior adviser and national spokeswoman for the progressive group MoveOn said on Friday, according to the Washington, D.C. newspaper.

zhs: 据 MIC 报道，尽管有克里斯汀·布莱西·福特 (Christine Blasey Ford) 博士的证词，但控制着司法委员会的共和党人仍选择继续支持卡瓦诺的提名，导致周五早上发生与参议院走廊上如出一辙的游行示威，抗议者们高呼“11 月到了！”。
en: On Friday morning, protestors chanted "November is coming!" as they demonstrated in the hallway of the Senate as the Republicans controlling the Judiciary Committee chose to move forward with Kavanaugh's nomination despite the testimony of Dr. Christine Blasey Ford, Mic reported.

zhs: 无党派政治分析人士斯图亚特·罗森博格 (Stu Rothenberg) 向新闻网站透露，“民主的热情和积极性即将透支”。
en: "Democratic enthusiasm and motivation is going to be off the chart," Stu Rothenberg, a nonpartisan political analyst, told the news site.

zhs: “人们说热情已经十分高涨了；这没错。
en: "People are saying it's already been high; that's true.

zhs: 但热情还能更高，特别是郊区地区举棋不定的女性选民和年轻选民（18 - 29 岁），通常当他们不喜欢总统时，这些人便不会投票”。
en: But it could be higher, particularly among swing women voters in the suburbs and younger voters, 18- to 29-year-olds, who while they don't like the president, often don't vote."

zhs: 在福特的公开证词详细说明其对最高法院候选人有关性侵的指控之前，分析人士就曾警告称如果共和党继续推行表决，那么将引发强烈的反对。
en: Even before Ford's public testimony detailing her allegations of sexual assault against the Supreme Court nominee, analysts suggested a backlash could follow if Republicans pushed forward with the confirmation.

zhs: 据美国全国广播公司新闻 (NBC News) 报道，共和党全国委员会前主席迈克尔·斯蒂尔 (Michael Steele) 表示“这将为大老党 (GOP) 带来混乱局面”。
en: "This has become a muddled mess for the GOP," said Michael Steele, former chairman of the Republican National Committee, early last week, according to NBC News.

zhs: 优先美国行动（Priorities USA，一个帮助选举民主党人的组织）主管盖伊·塞西尔 (Guy Cecil) 向新闻频道指出，“这不仅仅关乎委员会的投票或最终投票结果，或者是否会将卡瓦诺放在替补席位上，也关乎共和党处理这一问题的方式以及他们对待受害者的方式”。
en: "It's just not about the committee vote or the final vote or whether Kavanaugh is put on the bench, it's also about the way Republicans have handled this and how they have treated her," Guy Cecil, director of Priorities USA, a group that helps to elect Democrats, pointed out to the news channel.

zhs: 然而，随着福特和卡瓦诺的证词相继出炉，对于应该相信谁，美国民众似乎产生了一些分歧，稍稍倾向于后者。
en: However, Americans appear to be somewhat split over who to believe in the wake of Ford's and Kavanaugh's testimonies, with slightly more siding with the latter.

zhs: YouGov 的最新民意调查显示，41% 的调查对象明确或可能相信福特的证词，而 35% 的调查对象表示他们明确或可能相信卡瓦诺。
en: A new poll from YouGov shows that 41 percent of respondents definitely or probably believed Ford's testimony, while 35 percent said they definitely or probably believed Kavanaugh.

zhs: 此外，38% 的调查对象表示他们认为卡瓦诺的证词中可能或一定说了谎，而只有 30% 的调查对象表示他们认为福特的证词中可能或一定说了谎。
en: Additionally, 38 percent said they thought Kavanaugh has probably or definitely lied during his testimony, while just 30 percent said the same about Ford.

zhs: 据《卫报》报道，在弗雷克的争取下，联邦调查局 (FBI) 目前正在对福特以及至少一名其他控告者，黛博拉·拉米雷斯 (Deborah Ramirez) 提出的指控进行调查。
en: After the push from Flake, the FBI is currently investigating the allegations brought forward by Ford as well as at least one other accuser, Deborah Ramirez, The Guardian reported.

zhs: 上周，福特在参议院司法委员会面前宣誓作证，证明卡瓦诺曾在她 17 岁时醉酒后强奸了她。
en: Ford testified before the Senate Judiciary Committee under oath last week that Kavanaugh drunkenly assaulted her at the age of 17.

zhs: 拉米雷斯指控最高法院候选人曾在 20 世纪 80 年代他们就读于耶鲁大学期间，在派对上向她裸露生殖器。
en: Ramirez alleges that the Supreme Court nominee exposed his genitals to her while they attended a party during their time studying at Yale in the 1980s.

zhs: 万维网发明者计划开创可与谷歌和脸书 (Facebook) 较量的新互联网
en: The Inventor of the World Wide Web Plans to Start a New Internet to Take on Google and Facebook

zhs: 万维网发明者蒂姆·伯纳斯-李 (World Wide Web)，日前正在启动一家试图与脸书、亚马逊和谷歌匹敌的创业公司。
en: Tim Berners-Lee, the inventor of the World Wide Web, is launching a startup that seeks to rival Facebook, Amazon and Google.

zhs: 科技领域传奇性的最新项目，Inrupt，是一家以伯纳斯-李的开源平台 Solid 为基础构建的公司。
en: The technology legend's latest project, Inrupt, is a company that builds off of Berners-Lee's open source platform Solid.

zhs: Solid 允许用户选择将其数据存储在何处，以及允许哪些人访问哪些信息。
en: Solid allows users to choose where their data is stored and what people are allowed to have access to what information.

zhs: 在一次接受《快公司》(Fast Company) 的独家采访中，伯纳斯-李开玩笑称，Inrupt 背后的意图就是“统治世界”。
en: In an exclusive interview with Fast Company, Berners-Lee joked that the intent behind Inrupt is "world domination."

zhs: 说到这家创业公司，他表示“我们必须马上行动起来”。
en: "We have to do it now," he said of the startup.

zhs: “现在是历史性的时刻”。
en: "It's a historical moment."

zhs: 该应用利用 Solid 的技术允许用户创建自己的“个人在线数据存储”或 POD。
en: The app uses Solid's technology to allow people to create their own "personal online data store" or a POD.

zhs: 其中可以包含联系人列表、待办事项、日历、乐库以及其他个人和专业工具。
en: It can contain contact lists, to-do lists, calendar, music library and other personal and professional tools.

zhs: 与 Google Drive、Microsoft Outlook、Slack 和 Spotify 一样，它可以同时在同一个浏览器上使用。
en: It's like Google Drive, Microsoft Outlook, Slack and Spotify are all available on one browser and all at the same time.

zhs: 个人在线数据存储独有的特性在于，完全由用户决定哪些人可以访问哪类信息。
en: What's unique about the personal online data store is that it is completely up to the user who can access what kind of information.

zhs: 公司将这一特性称为“通过数据实现个人赋权”。
en: The company calls it "personal empowerment through data."

zhs: 据公司首席执行官 (CEO) 约翰·布鲁斯 (John Bruce) 表示，Inrupt 的意图是帮助公司引进资源、流程和适当的技能，以便所有人都可以使用 Solid。
en: The idea for Inrupt, according to the company's CEO John Bruce, is for the company to bring resources, process and appropriate skills to help make Solid available to everyone.

zhs: 该公司目前包括伯纳斯-李、布鲁斯、一个被 IBM 收购的安全平台、一些签约致力于该项目的专职开发人员以及一个程序员志愿者社区。
en: The company currently consists of Berners-Lee, Bruce, a security platform bought by IBM, some on-staff developers contracted to work on the project, and a community of volunteer coders.

zhs: 本周开始，世界各地的技术开发人员将利用 Inrupt 网站上可用的工具，创建其自己的去中心化应用。
en: Starting this week, technology developers around the world could create their own decentralized apps using the tools available on the Inrupt website.

zhs: 伯纳斯-李称，他和他的团队并非正在与“脸书 (Facebook) 和谷歌讨论是否要在他们的所有商业模式在一夜之间完全颠覆的情况下做出彻底改变。
en: Berners-Lee said that he and his team are not talking to "Facebook and Google about whether or not to introduce a complete change where all their business models are completely upended overnight.

zhs: “我们并非在征得他们的准许”。
en: "We are not asking their permission."

zhs: 周六在 Medium 上发布的一条贴子中，伯纳斯-李写到，Inrupt 的“使命是提供商业能源和生态系统，从而帮助保护以 Solid 为基础的新网络的质量和完整性”。
en: In a post on Medium published on Saturday, Berners-Lee wrote that Inrupt's "mission is to provide commercial energy and an ecosystem to help protect the integrity and quality of the new web built on Solid."

zhs: 1994 年，伯纳斯-李在麻省理工学院成立了万维网联盟，从而改变了互联网。
en: In 1994, Berners-Lee transformed the Internet when he established the World Wide Web Consortium at Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

zhs: 近几个月来，伯纳斯-李成为了网络中立性辩论的中坚力量。
en: In recent months, Berners-Lee has been an influential voice in the net neutrality debate.

zhs: 即便在启动 Inrupt 期间，伯纳斯-李仍然担任着万维网联盟、Web 基金会和开放数据研究所的创始人兼主管。
en: Even while launching Inrupt, Berners-Lee will remain the Founder and Director of World Wide Web Consortium, the Web Foundation and the Open Data Institute.

zhs: “我非常看好下一代网络”，伯纳斯-李补充到。
en: "I'm incredibly optimistic for this next era of the web," Berners-Lee added.

zhs: Bernard Vann：纪念一战维多利亚十字勋章获得者
en: Bernard Vann: WW1 Victoria Cross cleric celebrated

zhs: 在第一次世界大战期间，唯一一名参加作战而获得维多利亚十字勋章的英国国教会神职人员，时隔 100 年，家乡举行庆祝仪式。
en: The only Church of England cleric to win a Victoria Cross during World War One as a combatant has been celebrated in his hometown 100 years on.

zhs: 牧师 Bernard Vann 中校于 1918 年 9 月 29 日在 Bellenglise 和 Lehaucourt 之战中荣获勋章。
en: Lt Col The Reverend Bernard Vann won the award on 29 September 1918 in the attack at Bellenglise and Lehaucourt.

zhs: 不幸的是，四天后便被一名狙击手杀死，因此无人知道他曾赢得了英国这项最高的军事荣誉。
en: However, he was killed by a sniper four days later and never knew he had won the highest British military honour.

zhs: 周六，在北安普敦郡拉什登的一次列队游行中，他的两个孙子为纪念碑揭幕。
en: A commemorative stone was unveiled by his two grandsons at a parade in Rushden, Northamptonshire, on Saturday.

zhs: 他的孙子 Michael Vann 说，这块纪念碑是“辉煌的象征”，纪念自己的祖父荣获勋章整整 100 年。
en: One of his grandsons, Michael Vann, said it was "brilliantly symbolic" the stone would be revealed exactly 100 years on from his grandfather's award-winning feat.

zhs: 据《伦敦公报》，1918 年 9 月 29 日，Vann 中校带领军队，“冒着浓雾，在野战炮和机枪的枪林弹雨中”横渡圣昆廷运河 (Canal de Saint-Quentin)。
en: According to the London Gazette, on 29 September 1918 Lt Col Vann led his battalion across the Canal de Saint-Quentin "through a very thick fog and under heavy fire from field and machine guns."

zhs: 随后，他便冲向最前线，“英勇地”领导前线战士冲锋陷阵，然后单手持野战炮扫射，击退了三支小分队。
en: He later rushed up to the firing line and with the "greatest gallantry" led the line forward before rushing a field-gun single-handed and knocked out three of the detachment.

zhs: 1918 年 10 月 4 日，在战争结束一个多月前，Colt Vann 被一名德国狙击手射杀。
en: Lt Col Vann was killed by a German sniper on 4 October 1918 - just over a month before the war ended.

zhs: 72 岁的 Michael Vann 评价祖父的行为是，“我清楚，祖父的英勇，我永远比不上，但会让我保持谦恭的态度”。
en: Michael Vann, 72, said his grandfather's actions were "something that I know that I could never live up to but something which is humbling."

zhs: 此次游行的领队是布伦特伍德帝国青年乐队。游行结束后，Michael Vann 与和他的兄弟 James Vann 博士献上了花圈。
en: He and his brother Dr James Vann also laid a wreath after the parade, which was led by the Brentwood Imperial Youth Band.

zhs: Michael Vann 说他“非常荣幸能参加游行”，后又补充说“真正的英雄，从众人所给予的支持中，便能看出何其英勇”。
en: Michael Vann said he was "feeling very honoured to play a part in the parade" and added "the valour of a genuine hero is being demonstrated by the support that is going to be given by a lot of people."

zhs: MMA 粉丝彻夜等待的节目 Bellator 206 变成了《小猪佩奇》
en: MMA fans stayed up all night to watch Bellator 206, they got Peppa Pig instead

zhs: 想象一下，你彻夜未眠，等着看 Bellator 206 比赛，可到头来却被告知无法观看主赛事。
en: Imagine this, you have stayed up all night to watch the a packed Bellator 206 only to be denied watching the main event.

zhs: San Jose 有 13 场比赛，其中主赛事有 6 场比赛。英国第 5 频道对比赛连夜进行现场直播。
en: The bill from San Jose contained 13 fights, including six on the main card and was being shown live through the night in the UK on Channel 5.

zhs: 早上 6 点，就在 Gegard Mousasi 和 Rory MacDonald 准备对决之时，频道内容却改为了《小猪佩奇》，英国观众大为震惊。
en: At 6am, just as Gegard Mousasi and Rory MacDonald were preparing to face each other, viewers in the UK were left stunned when the coverage changed to Peppa Pig.

zhs: 有些人一宿未眠，等到了凌晨，特意要看这场拳击比赛，却大跌眼镜。
en: Some were unimpressed after they had stayed awake until the early hours especially for the fight.

zhs: Twitter 上，一位粉丝称，将节目改成动画片，简直就是“倒人胃口的笑话”。
en: One fan on Twitter described the switch to the children's cartoon as "some sort of sick joke."

zhs: Bellator 的高级营销和传播副总裁 Dave Schwartz 在被问及节目播出的这个问题时，说道，“”政府有规定，上午 6 点不宜播放此类节目，所以电视台才被迫换成了儿童节目”。
en: "It's government regulation that at 6 a.m. that content was not suitable so they had to switch to children's programming, " said Dave Schwartz, Bellator senior vice president of marketing and communication, when asked about the transmission.
""Peppa the pig," yes."

zhs: Bellator 公司总裁 Scott Coker 表示，未来的安排中，会尽量将英国观众包括在内。
en: Bellator company president Scott Coker said that they are going to work on their scheduling to include UK viewers in the future.

zhs: “我想，在考虑重播时，可以解决这个问题”，Coker 说道。
en: "I think that when I think about the replay, I think that we can probably work it out," Coker said.

zhs: “可是当时是英国周日早上六点钟，可我们也只能等到我们这边的周日，再播，那时就是英国的周一了。
en: "But it's six in the morning on a Sunday there and we won't be able to work this out until Sunday our time, Monday their time.

zhs: 不过，我们还在想办法。
en: But we are working on it.

zhs: 相信我，节目换了之后，我收到了好多信息，而且都是不友好的内容。
en: Believe me, when it switched over there were a lot of texts going back and forth and they all were not friendly.

zhs: 我们当时也想办法了，我们以为是技术故障。
en: We were trying to fix it, we thought it was a technical glitch.

zhs: 可其实并不是，这是政府管制的问题。
en: But it wasn't, it was a governmental issue.

zhs: 我可以向大家保证，下次不会发生这种事了。
en: I can promise you the next time it's not going to happen.

zhs: 我们会控制为五场比赛，而非六场比赛，通常我们都是打五场的，我们本想让粉丝们多些享受，却过长了。
en: We'll keep it down to five fights instead of six - like we normally do - and we tried to overdeliver for the fans and we just went over.

zhs: 情况有些尴尬。”
en: It's an unfortunate situation."

zhs: Desert Island Discs：Tom Daley 因性取向而自卑
en: Desert Island Discs: Tom Daley felt 'inferior' over sexuality

zhs: 奥运会潜水员托马斯·戴利 (Tom Daley) 说，由于自己的性取向，他从小就感觉很自卑，但这也成为了他取得成功的动力。
en: Olympic diver Tom Daley says he grew up feeling inferior to everyone because of his sexuality - but that gave him the motivation to become a success.

zhs: 这位 24 岁的小伙子说，上了中学之后，他才发现“并不是每个人都像我一样”。
en: The 24-year-old said he did not realise until he went to secondary school that "not everyone is like me."

zhs: 在 Lauren Laverne 主持的广播 4 频道的《Desert Island Discs》节目中，他说自己谈论同性恋权利就是为了给其他人“希望”。
en: Speaking on the first Radio 4 Desert Island Discs presented by Lauren Laverne, he said he spoke out about gay rights to give others "hope."

zhs: 他还介绍称，有了孩子之后，他对取得奥运会冠军这个问题不太那么关系了。
en: He also said becoming a parent made him care less about winning the Olympics.

zhs: 这个常青节目的定期主持人 Kirsty Young 因病已经休了好几个月。
en: The regular presenter of the long-running show, Kirsty Young, has taken a number of months off because of illness.

zhs: 作为 Laverne 首场主持节目的嘉宾，Daley 表示，他在自己的成长过程中，感觉比其他人“低一等”，因为“社会不接受男孩和女孩同性之间的交往。”
en: Appearing as a castaway on Laverne's first programme, Daley said he felt "less than" everyone else growing up because "it wasn't socially acceptable to like boys and girls."

zhs: 他说道：“直到今天，我还是会真真切切地感觉到，低人一等，感觉自己另类，但这也给了我成功力量。”
en: He said: "To this day, those feelings of feeling less than, and feeling different, have been the real things that have given me the power and strength to be able to succeed."

zhs: 他说道，他想证明自己“有所作为”，这样，当人们知道自己的性取向时，才不会让大家失望。
en: He wanted to prove that he was "something," he said, so that he did not disappoint everyone when they eventually found out about his sexuality.

zhs: Daley 已经赢得了两次奥运会铜牌，现在成为了一名备受瞩目的 LGBT 活动家，并在今年的澳大利亚英联邦运动会上出面，呼吁更多国家将同性恋合法化。
en: The two-time bronze Olympic medallist has become a high-profile LGBT campaigner and used his appearance at this year's Commonwealth Games in Australia to appeal for more countries to decriminalise homosexuality.

zhs: 他说，自己之所以敢于发声，是因为他觉得自己很幸运，能够公开地生活而没有任何后果，他想给其他人“希望”。
en: He said he spoke out because he felt lucky to be able to live openly without ramifications and wanted to give others "hope."

zhs: 这位三届世界冠军表示，自己在 2013 年遇到了美国电影制片人达斯汀·兰斯·布莱克 (Dustin Lance Black)，当他发现自己爱上了这个男人的时候，“我自己都惊呆了。”
en: The three-time world champion said falling in love with a man - US film-maker Dustin Lance Black, who he met in 2013 - "caught me by surprise."

zhs: 去年，Daley 与这位年长自己 20 岁的奥斯卡奖得主完婚，他表示，年龄差距从来都不是问题。
en: Daley married the Oscar winner, who is 20 years his senior, last year but he said the age gap had never been an issue.

zhs: Daley 在 14 岁那年便首次参加奥运会，三年后，他的父亲因癌症病逝。他说道：“那么小的年纪，就经历了这么多，在年龄相仿的人中，很难找到有类似人生起伏的人。"
en: "When you go through so much at such a young age" - he went to his first Olympics aged 14 and his father died of cancer three years later - he said that it was hard to find someone the same age who had experienced similar highs and lows.

zhs: 这对夫妇于六月有了自己的儿子，取名 Robert Ray Black-Daley。之后，Daley 的“整体观点”都改变了。
en: The couple became parents in June, to a son called Robert Ray Black-Daley, and Daley said his "whole perspective" had changed.

zhs: “如果去年你问我，我会说'我得赢一枚金牌'，”他说道。
en: "If you had asked me last year, it was all about 'I need to win a gold medal'," he said.

zhs: “但你知道吗，还有比奥运会金牌更重大的事。
en: "You know what, there are bigger things than Olympic gold medals.

zhs: Robbie 就是我的奥运金牌。”
en: My Olympic gold medal is Robbie."

zhs: 他为儿子取了一个与父亲 Robert 相同的名字，纪念 2011 年因脑癌而病逝的父亲（享年 40 岁）。
en: His son has the same name as his father Robert, who died in 2011 aged 40 after being diagnosed with brain cancer.

zhs: Daley 说他的父亲不相信自己会死，他最后的一个问题就是问有没有 2012 年伦敦奥运会的门票，因为他想要坐在前排的位置。
en: Daley said his dad did not accept he was going to die and one of the last things he had asked was if they had their tickets yet for London 2012 - as he wanted to be on the front row.

zhs: “我没法对他说'爸爸，你不能坐在前排'，”他说道。
en: "I couldn't say to him 'you're not going to be around to be on the front row dad'," he said.

zhs: “他停止呼吸的时候，我正握着他的手，实际上，直到他已经停止了呼吸，已经死了，我才承认他不会永远不倒”，他说道。
en: "I was holding his hand as he stopped breathing and it wasn't until he'd actually stopped breathing and he was dead that I finally acknowledged he wasn't invincible," he said.

zhs: 第二年，Daley 参加了 2012 年奥运会，获得了铜牌。
en: The following year Daley competed at the 2012 Olympics and won bronze.

zhs: “我当时只是知道，这就是我一生梦寐以求的，在奥运会期间在主场观众面前潜水，没有比这更好的感觉了”，他说道。
en: "I just knew that this is what I had dreamt of my whole life - to dive in front of a home crowd at an Olympic Games, there was no better feeling," he said.

zhs: 也正是因为这一点，Proud by Heather Small 成了他最爱的歌曲，他是在奥运会的筹备过程中爱上了这首歌曲，现在，听到这首歌，他还会为之一振。
en: It also inspired his first song choice - Proud by Heather Small - which had resonated with him in the build up to the Olympics and still gave him goosebumps.

zhs: Desert Island Discs 的播出时间为周日 11:15 (BST)，播出频道为 BBC 广播 4 频道。
en: Desert Island Discs is on BBC Radio 4 on Sunday at 11:15 BST.

zhs: 球感欠佳的米克尔森周六在莱德杯上被换下场
en: Out-of-form Mickelson benched on Ryder Cup Saturday

zhs: 美国球员菲尔·米克尔森 (Phil Mickelson) 将在周日他的第 47 场莱德杯比赛中创造纪录，但他必须调整自己的状态，避免上演负面的里程碑事件。
en: American Phil Mickelson will set a record on Sunday when he plays his 47th Ryder Cup match, but he will have to turn his form around to avoid it being an unhappy milestone.

zhs: 米克尔森，第 12 次参加这项两年一度的赛事，在周六的四人四球赛和四人两球赛中被队长吉姆·福瑞克 (Jim Furyk) 替换下场。
en: Mickelson, playing in the biennial event for a record 12th time, was benched by captain Jim Furyk for Saturday's fourballs and foursomes.

zhs: 这位五次大满贯得主不但没有像在美国时一样成为比赛的中坚力量，反而把一天的时间都花费在了拉拉队和训练场上，希望尽快纠正自己的问题重返赛场。
en: Instead of being at the center of the action, as he so often has been for the United States, the five-times major winner split his day between being a cheerleader and working on his game on the range in the hope of rectifying what ails him.

zhs: 即便在职业生涯的巅峰时期，手持最笔直的高尔夫球杆，气氛紧张的法国国家高尔夫球场 (Le Golf National) 也不适合这位 48 岁的选手，这里高低不平的路线会为偏离轨道的射击增加难度。
en: Never the straightest of drivers even at the peak of his career, the 48-year-old is not an ideal fit for the tight Le Golf National course, where the long rough routinely punishes errant shots.

zhs: 如果球场本身不够威严，米克尔森将在周日的第九场比赛中对战精准的英国高尔夫公开赛冠军弗兰西斯科·莫里纳利 (Francesco Molinari)，弗兰西斯科·莫里纳利已经与新手汤米·弗利特伍德 (Tommy Fleetwood ) 合作拿下了他们本周四场比赛的全部胜利。
en: And if the course on its own is not daunting enough, Mickelson, in the ninth match on Sunday, faces accurate British Open champion Francesco Molinari, who has teamed up with rookie Tommy Fleetwood to win all four of their matches this week.

zhs: 如果美国队以四分的落差开始 12 场单打比赛，那么若要打出良好的开局，米克尔森的比赛将至关重要。
en: If the Americans, four points down starting the 12 singles matches, get off to a hot start, Mickelson's match could prove absolutely crucial.

zhs: 福瑞克表示对自己的队员有信心，但除此之外他无话可说。
en: Furyk expressed confidence in his man, not that he could say much else.

zhs: “他完全理解自己今天所扮演的角色，拍了拍我的背，用手臂搂住我说他明天一定会准备好”，福瑞克说到。
en: "He fully understood the role that he had today, gave me a pat on the back and put his arm around me and said he would be ready tomorrow," Furyk said.

zhs: “他对自己非常有信心。
en: "He's got a lot of confidence in himself.

zhs: 他是名人堂 (Hall of Famer) 的一员，过去为团队做出了巨大贡献，本周也是。
en: He's a Hall of Famer and he's added so much to these teams in the past, and this week.

zhs: 我可能没指望他会打两场比赛。
en: I probably didn't envision him playing two matches.

zhs: 我希望他打更多比赛，但结果就是这样，也是不得不接受。
en: I envisioned more, but that's the way it worked out and that's the way we thought we had to go.

zhs: 和其他人一样，他也想在赛场上大放异彩。”
en: He wants to be out there, just like everyone else."

zhs: 周日，米克尔森将打破尼克·福尔多 (Nick Faldo) 创下的莱德杯比赛场次最多的记录。
en: Mickelson will pass Nick Faldo's record for the most Ryder Cup matches played on Sunday.

zhs: 这可能标志着莱德杯职业生涯的结束，而他的个人记录却从未达到如此的高度。
en: It could mark the end of a Ryder Cup career that has never quite matched the heights of his individual record.

zhs: 米克尔森取得了 18 胜 20 负 7 平的成绩，尽管福瑞克说他的出现给球队带来了一些无形的力量。
en: Mickelson has 18 wins, 20 losses and seven halves, though Furyk said his presence brought some intangibles to the team.

zhs: “他滑稽、尖酸、诙谐、喜欢取笑别人，在队里是个大好人”，他解释到。
en: "He's funny, he's sarcastic, witty, likes to poke fun at people, and he's a great guy to have in the team room," he explained.

zhs: “我想年轻的球员们很喜欢戏弄他，而在本周，这将很有趣。
en: "I think the younger players had fun having a go at him, as well, this week, which was fun to see.

zhs: 除了比赛，他还带给我们很多”。
en: He provides a lot more than just play."

zhs: 欧洲队长托马斯·比约恩 (Thomas Bjorn) 意识到大比分领先的局面即将被破
en: Europe captain Thomas Bjorn knows big lead can soon disappear

zhs: 来自欧洲的队长托马斯·比约恩 (Thomas Bjorn) 根据经验判断，以大比分领先的优势进入莱德杯的单打决赛，很容易产生不利的局面。
en: Thomas Bjorn, the European captain, knows from experience that a sizeable lead heading into the last-day singles in the Ryder Cup can easily turn into an uncomfortable ride.

zhs: 戴恩于 1997 年瓦德拉玛 (Valderrama) 的比赛中首次亮相，当时，塞维·巴列斯特罗斯 (Seve Ballesteros) 担任队长的一方较美国队以五分优势领先，但最终只是 14½-13½ 以极其微弱优势的险胜。
en: The Dane made his debut in the 1997 match at Valderrama, where a side captained by Seve Ballesteros held a five-point advantage over the Americans but only just got over the finishing line with their noses in front by the narrowest of margins, winning 14½-13½.

zhs: 在观看了周五和昨天在法国国家高尔夫球场 (Le Golf National) 举行的 2018 届两场比赛（分别以 5-3 胜出，最终以 10-6 的比分领先）后，比约恩描述到，“你们要时刻提醒自己我们在瓦德拉玛 (Valderrama) 和布鲁克莱恩曾以大比分领先；虽然在布鲁克莱恩我们输了，但在瓦德拉玛 (Valderrama) 我们获得了险胜”。
en: "You keep reminding yourself that we had a big lead at Valderrama; we had a big lead at Brookline, where we lost, and at Valderrama, where we won, but only just," said Bjorn, pictured, after watching the Class of 2018 win 5-3 both on Friday and yesterday to lead 10-6 at Le Golf National.

zhs: 历史会告诉我和每一位队员，一切并未结束。
en: So history will show me and everybody on that team that this is not over.

zhs: 在明天到来之前你必须全力以赴。
en: You go full bore tomorrow.

zhs: 走出去，去做正确的事。
en: Get out there and do all the right things.

zhs: 一切并没有结束，直至分数登上积分榜。
en: This is not over till you've got the points on the board.

zhs: 我们的目标就是努力赢得奖杯，而这也是我们关注的重点。
en: We have a goal, and that is to try to win this trophy, and that's where the focus stays.

zhs: 我一直在说，我关注的是我们队的 12 名球员，但我们非常清楚，我们即将面对的是什么 - 世界上最强大的球员”。
en: I've said all along, I focus on the 12 players that are in our side, but we are so well aware of what's standing across on the other side - the greatest players in the world."

zhs: 比约恩对球员们在高尔夫球场上的艰难对抗感到满意，他补充道：“在这方面，我永远都没办法战胜自己。
en: Delighted how his players have performed on a tough golf course, Bjorn added: "I would never get ahead of myself in this.

zhs: 明天又是一场恶战。
en: Tomorrow's a different beast.

zhs: 明天是一场自告奋勇的个人表演，与平时有些不同。
en: Tomorrow is the individual performances that come forward, and that is a different thing to do.

zhs: 如果比赛进展顺利，和搭档并肩作战将是件很棒的事情，但是如果孤军奋战，作为一名高尔夫球手，考验的将是你的整体能力。
en: It's great to be out there with a partner when things are going good, but when you're out there individually, then you're tested to the full of your capacity as a golfer.

zhs: 这就是你需要让队员们明白的信息，明天充分发挥个人能力。
en: That's the message that you need to get across to players, is get the best out of yourself tomorrow.

zhs: 现在，你必须离开你的搭档，而你的搭档也必须离开你，各自充分发挥自己的能力。”
en: Now, you leave your partner behind and he has to go and get the best out of himself, as well."

zhs: 与比约恩不同，对方的吉姆·福瑞克 (Jim Furyk) 期待队员们的个人表现能够超越搭档表现，在四分中拿下三分的乔丹·斯皮思 (Jordan Spieth) 和贾斯汀‧托马斯 (Justin Thomas) 除外。
en: In contrast to Bjorn, opposite number Jim Furyk will be looking for his players to perform better individually than they did as partners, the exceptions being Jordan Spieth and Justin Thomas, who picked up three points out of four.

zhs: 随着欧洲队努力实现“梅黛娜奇迹 (Miracle at Medinah)”以失败告终，作为布鲁克莱恩获胜队的一员，福瑞克已然站在决赛转折点的两端，胜败皆有可能。
en: Furyk himself has been on both ends of those big last-day turnarounds, having been part of the winning team at Brookline before ending up a loser as Europe pulled off the "Miracle at Medinah."

zhs: 在被问及本·克伦肖 (Ben Crenshaw) （1999 年的时任队长）如何为队员们鼓舞士气迎接决赛时，他回答道“我记得每一个该死的字眼”。
en: "I remember every damn word of it," he said in reply to being asked how Ben Crenshaw, the captain in 1999, had rallied his players heading into the last day.

zhs: “明天我们有 12 场重要的比赛，但是你们可能想像在瓦德拉玛 (Valderrama) 和布鲁克莱恩一样先发制人。
en: "We have 12 important matches tomorrow, but you'd like to get off to that fast start like you saw at Brookline, like you saw at Medinah.

zhs: 如果大家都往同一个方向使劲，那么会给中场比赛带来很大压力。
en: When that momentum gets going one way, it puts a lot of pressure on those middle matches.

zhs: “所以我们的阵容进行了相应的调整，以对我们有利的方式出场，大家都知道，我们正在努力争取明天创造奇迹。”
en: We set up our line-up accordingly and put the guys out in the fashion that we felt like, you know, we're trying to make some magic tomorrow."

zhs: 托马斯负责带领球队反击，他将在决赛中对战罗里·麦克罗伊 (Rory McIlroy)，半决赛中依次对战保罗·凯西 (Paul Casey)、贾斯汀·罗斯 (Justin Rose)、乔恩·拉姆 (Jon Rahm)、汤米·弗利特伍德 (Tommy Fleetwood) 和伊恩·波尔特 (Ian Poulter) 等欧洲球员。
en: Thomas has been handed the task of trying to lead the fightback and faces Rory McIlroy in the top match, with Paul Casey, Justin Rose, Jon Rahm, Tommy Fleetwood and Ian Poulter the other Europeans in the top half of the order.

zhs: 说到单打比赛，比约恩表示，“我以这样的顺序部署球员，是全方面考虑之后做出的决定”。
en: "I went with this group of guys in this order because I think it covers all the way through," said Bjorn of his singles selections.

zhs: 德国新战舰再次延期亮相
en: Germany's new warship postponed yet again

zhs: 据当地媒体报道，德国海军最新护卫舰本应于 2014 年进行调试，以替换冷战时期老旧的战舰，但是由于系统故障以及成本滚雪球式的增长，直至明年，我们都无法看到该护卫舰的亮相。
en: German Navy's newest frigate should have been commissioned in 2014 to replace ageing Cold War-era warships, but it won't be there until at least the next year due to faulty systems and snowballing cost, local media reported.

zhs: 据 Die Zeit 报纸报道，军方发言人表示，全新巴登-符腾堡级护卫舰的主舰 - “莱茵兰-普法尔茨号”的调试工作目前被推迟至 2019 年上半年。
en: Commissioning of the "Rheinland-Pfalz," the lead ship of the brand new Baden-Wuerttemberg-class frigates, has now been postponed until the first half of 2019, according to Die Zeit newspaper citing a military spokesman.

zhs: 这艘护卫舰本应于 2014 年服役于海军，但令人头疼的生产后问题一致困扰着这项浩瀚工程的命运。
en: The vessel should have joined the Navy in 2014, but the troubling post-delivery issues plagued the fate of the ambitious project.

zhs: 2007 年海军召回的四艘巴登-符腾堡级护卫舰将替代老旧的巴登-符腾堡级护卫舰。
en: The four Baden-Wuerttemberg-class vessels the Navy ordered back in 2007 will come as replacement to the ageing Bremen-class frigates.

zhs: 据了解，这艘护卫舰将拥有强大的火力、大批防空和反舰艇导弹以及一些隐形技术、如减少雷达、红外线和声学信号。
en: It is understood they will feature a powerful cannon, an array of anti-aircraft and anti-ship missiles as well as some stealth technologies, such as reduced radar, infrared and acoustic signatures.

zhs: 其他重要特征还包括维护周期较长 - 可以远离母港对最新护卫舰进行长达两年的部署。
en: Other important features include longer maintenance periods - it should be possible to deploy the newest frigates for up to two years away from home ports.

zhs: 然而，连续的延期意味着最先进的战舰 - 据说可以让德国在海外部署力量 - 在那投入使用之时，将已经过时。
en: However, continuous delays mean that the cutting-edge warships - said to allow Germany to project power overseas - will already become outdated by the time they enter service, Die Zeit notes.

zhs: 早在去年德国海军正式拒绝调试该护卫舰，并将其退还给汉堡的 Blohm & Voss 船厂时，这艘命运多端的 F125 护卫舰便已成为新闻焦点。
en: The ill-fated F125 frigate made headlines last year, when the German Navy officially refused to commission the vessel and returned it to Blohm & Voss shipyard in Hamburg.

zhs: 这是海军首次在交付后将船舰退还给造船厂。
en: This was the first time the Navy has returned a ship to a shipbuilder after delivery.

zhs: 关于此次退回的原因，外界知之甚少，但德国媒体援引了一些关键的“软件和硬件缺陷”，称这些缺陷将导致战舰在执行作战任务时毫无用处。
en: Little was known about the reasons behind the return, but German media cited a number of crucial "software and hardware defects" that made the warship useless if deployed on a combat mission.

zhs: 由于巴登-符腾堡级护卫舰将由 120 名船员操控，只需要老旧巴登-符腾堡级护卫舰一半的人力，因此软件缺陷将尤为致命。
en: Software deficiencies were particularly important as the Baden-Wuerttemberg-class vessels will be operated by a crew of some 120 sailors - just half of the manpower on older Bremen class frigates.

zhs: 同样，据透露，该护卫舰严重超重，这将降低其性能并限制海军添加未来升级的能力。
en: Also, it emerged that the ship is dramatically overweight which reduces its performance and limits the Navy's ability to add future upgrades.

zhs: 据称，这艘 7,000 吨重的“莱茵兰-普法尔茨号”的重量是德国二战时期所用的同等级护卫舰的二倍。
en: The 7,000-ton "Rheinland-Pfalz" is believed to be twice as heavy as similar-class ships used by the Germans in the Second World War.

zhs: 除硬件故障以外，整个项目的耗资 - 包括船员的培训 - 也成为一个令人头疼的问题。
en: Aside from faulty hardware, the price tag of the entire project - including the training of the crew - is also becoming an issue.

zhs: 据说耗资已经惊人地达到了 31 亿欧元（36 亿美元），而最初预算仅为 22 亿欧元。
en: It is said to have reached staggering €3.1billion ($3.6bn) - up from initial €2.2 billion.

zhs: 鉴于近期关于德国海军力量正在缩水的警告，最新护卫舰所临的问题变得更为严重。
en: Problems gripping the newest frigates become especially of importance in light of recent warnings that Germany's naval power is shrinking.

zhs: 今年年初，德国议会国防委员会主席汉斯-皮特·巴特尔斯 (Hans-Peter Bartels) 承认，德国海军实际上“已经没有可以部署的舰船了”。
en: Earlier this year, Hans-Peter Bartels, chief of the German parliament's defense committee, acknowledged the Navy is actually "running out of deployment-capable ships."

zhs: 这位官员表示，随着时间的推移，这一问题越来越严重，老旧的舰船逐渐退役，却没有可替代的新船舰。
en: The official said the issue has snowballed over time, because old ships were decommissioned but no replacement vessels were provided.

zhs: 他哀叹竟没有一艘巴登-符腾堡级护卫舰能够服役于海军。
en: He lamented that none of the of the Baden-Wuerttemberg-class frigates were able to join the Navy.

zhs: 国民信托窃听蝙蝠的秘密生活
en: National Trust eavesdrops on secret life of bats

zhs: 苏格兰高地的一处庄园正在进行一项新的研究，该研究旨在揭示蝙蝠如何利用这片土地进行觅食。
en: New research being carried out at an estate in the Scottish Highlands aims to reveal how bats use the landscape in their hunt for food.

zhs: 研究希望这一发现能够揭开这种独特的飞行类哺乳动物的行为面纱，并有助于指导未来的保护活动。
en: It is hoped the findings will shed new light on the behaviour of the unique flying mammals and help guide future conservation activities.

zhs: 苏格兰国民信托 (National Trust for Scotland) 的科学家们进行的这项研究，将在 Wester Ross 的因弗鲁花园 (Inverewe Gardens) 追踪常见的伏翼和高音伏翼以及棕色的长耳蝙蝠和 Daubenton 蝙蝠。
en: The study by scientists at the National Trust for Scotland will follow common and soprano pipistrelles as well as brown long-eared and Daubenton bats at Inverewe Gardens in Wester Ross.

zhs: 他们将在花园周围的一些关键位置安装特殊录音机，追踪蝙蝠一年四季的活动。
en: Special recorders will be placed at key locations around the property to track bat activities throughout the season.

zhs: NHS 工作人员和志愿者们将利用手持探测器进行流动调查。
en: NHS staff and volunteers will also carry out mobile surveys using hand-held detectors.

zhs: 然后对所有录音进行专业声音分析，以确定蝙蝠叫声的频率以及哪种蝙蝠在进行什么活动。
en: Expert sound analysis of all recordings will ascertain the frequency of the bat calls and which species are doing what.

zhs: 然后制作出栖息地地图和报告，以针对蝙蝠的行为生成详细的实景图片。
en: A habitat map and report will then be produced to create a detailed landscape-scale picture of their behaviour.

zhs: NHS 的自然保护顾问罗布·杜瓦 (Rob Dewar) 希望研究结果能够揭示哪块栖息地对蝙蝠来说至关重要，以及每种蝙蝠如何利用这些栖息地。
en: Rob Dewar, nature conservation adviser for NTS, hopes the results will reveal which areas of habitat are most important to the bats and how they are used by each of the species.

zhs: 这些信息将帮助判断栖息地管理工作的利益，例如，草地铺设以及如何最有效地维护蝙蝠以及其他相关物种生存的林地。
en: This information will help determine the benefits of habitat management work such as meadow creation and how best to maintain woodlands for bats and other associated species.

zhs: 但是过去一个世纪以来，苏格兰和英国地区的蝙蝠数量出现大幅下降。
en: Bat populations in Scotland and across the UK have declined considerably over the past century.

zhs: 建筑和开发工作对蝙蝠造成了巨大威胁，影响了它们的栖息处甚至导致它们失去栖息地。
en: They are under threat from building and development work that affects roosts and loss of habitat.

zhs: 风力涡轮机和照明、捕蝇纸和一些建筑材料的化学处理，以及宠物猫的攻击都对蝙蝠造成了风险。
en: Wind turbines and lighting can also pose a risk, as can flypapers and some chemical treatments of building materials, as well as attacks by pet cats.

zhs: 蝙蝠实际上是可以看见的。
en: Bats are not actually blind.

zhs: 然而，由于夜间狩猎习惯，在扑捉猎物时它们的耳朵比眼睛更为有用。
en: However, due to their nocturnal hunting habits their ears are more useful than their eyes when it comes to catching prey.

zhs: 它们能够利用复杂的回声定位技术准确定位飞行路径中的小虫和障碍物。
en: They use a sophisticated echo-location technique to pinpoint bugs and obstacles in their flight path.

zhs: 负责维护苏格兰 270 多幢历史建筑、38 间重要花园和 76,000 公顷土地的 NTS 对待蝙蝠的问题非常严肃。
en: The NTS, which is responsible for the care of more than 270 historical buildings, 38 important gardens and 76,000 hectares of land around the country, takes bats very seriously.

zhs: NTS 有十位身经百战的专家，他们定期进行调查、栖息处检测，有时也进行救援。
en: It has ten trained experts, who regularly carry out surveys, roost inspections and sometimes rescues.

zhs: 该组织甚至在位于丹弗里斯-加洛韦 (Dumfries and Galloway) 的 Threave 庄园建立了苏格兰第一个也是唯一一个专门的蝙蝠保护区，该保护区是苏格兰 8 种蝙蝠（共 10 种）的家园。
en: The organisation has even set up Scotland's first and only dedicated bat reserve at Threave estate in Dumfries and Galloway, which is home to eight of Scotland's ten bat species.

zhs: 庄园管理者戴维·汤普森 (David Thompson) 表示该庄园是蝙蝠们理想的沃土。
en: Estate manager David Thompson says the estate is the ideal territory for them.

zhs: “在 Threave 庄园，我们专为蝙蝠打造了一片区域”，汤普森表示。
en: "Here at Threave we have a great area for bats," he said.

zhs: “这里有老旧的建筑、成片的老树和所有绝佳的栖息地。
en: "We've got the old buildings, lots of veteran trees and all the good habitat.

zhs: 但是，关于蝙蝠还有很多未知的知识，所以我们在这里以及其他庄园所做的工作将帮助我们更多地了解蝙蝠如何才能茁壮成长。
en: But there is much about bats that is still unknown, so the work we do here and at other properties will help us understand more about what they need to thrive."

zhs: 汤普森强调，一定要在进行庄园维护之前检查蝙蝠的情况，因为如果在不知情的情况下破坏一个雌性蝙蝠栖息处，就可能导致多达 400 只雌性蝙蝠和蝙蝠幼崽死亡，进而导致当地种群完全灭绝。
en: He stresses the importance of checking for bats before carrying out maintenance within properties as it is possible unwitting destruction of a single maternity roost could kill up to 400 females and young, possibly wiping out an entire local population.

zhs: 蝙蝠是受保护的，捕杀、攻击、骚扰蝙蝠或破坏其栖息地都是违法行为。
en: Bats are protected and it is illegal to kill, harass or disturb them or destroy their roosts.

zhs: 蝙蝠保护基金会 (Bat Conservation Trust) 的苏格兰官员伊丽莎白·费雷尔 (Elisabeth Ferrell) 鼓励公众贡献自己的力量。
en: Elisabeth Ferrell, Scottish officer for the Bat Conservation Trust, has encouraged the public to pitch in to help.

zhs: 她表示：“对于蝙蝠以及我们不清楚其种群具体情况的许多其他物种而言，我们还有很多知识需要了解。”
en: She said: "We still have a lot to learn about our bats and for many of our species we just don't know how their populations are faring."

zhs: 罗纳尔多否认强奸指控，律师准备起诉德国杂志
en: Ronaldo dismisses rape claims as lawyers set to sue German magazine

zhs: 克里斯蒂亚诺·罗纳尔多 (Cristiano Ronaldo) 被“虚假新闻”冠以遭遇强奸指控的恶名，他表示人们想利用他来“炒作自己”。
en: Cristiano Ronaldo has branded rape claims against him as "fake news," saying that people "want to promote themselves" by using his name.

zhs: 他的律师准备起诉曾发表指控的德国新闻杂志《明镜周刊》。
en: His lawyers are set to sue German news magazine Der Spiegel, which published the allegations.

zhs: 这位葡萄牙和尤文图斯队的前锋被指控于拉斯维加斯某酒店的 2009 房间强奸美籍女子凯瑟琳·马约尔加 (Kathryn Mayorga)。
en: The Portugal and Juventus forward has been accused of raping an American woman, named as Kathryn Mayorga, in a Las Vegas hotel room in 2009.

zhs: 据《明镜周刊》周五报道，罗纳尔多被指称事后向这名女子偿付了 375,000 美元，让她对此次事件三缄其口。
en: He is alleged to have then paid her $375,000 to keep quiet about the incident, Der Spiegel reported on Friday.

zhs: 指控被曝光的数小时后，33 岁的罗纳尔多在 Instagram 上向 1.42 亿关注者发布了一段直播视频，指责这些报道为“虚假新闻”。
en: Speaking in an Instagram Live video to his 142 million followers hours after the claims were reported, Ronaldo, 33, slammed the reports as "fake news."

zhs: “不，不，不，不，不，
en: "No, no, no, no , no.

zhs: 他们今天所说的都是虚假新闻”，这位五次金球奖得主面对镜头说到。
en: What they said today, fake news," the five-time Ballon d'Or winner says into the camera.

zhs: “他们不过是想利用我的名字炒作自己。
en: "They want to promote themselves by using my name.

zhs: 这很正常。
en: It's normal.

zhs: 他们想利用我出名，但这也是他们工作的一部分。
en: They want to be famous to say my name, but it is part of the job.

zhs: 我是个幸福的人，各方面都很好”，罗纳尔多笑着补充到。
en: I am a happy man and all good," the player added, smiling.

zhs: 据路透社报道，罗纳尔多的律师准备就此次指控起诉《明镜周刊》，称其“未经许可的报道涉嫌侵犯个人隐私”。
en: Ronaldo's lawyers are preparing to sue Der Spiegel over the allegations, which they have called "an inadmissible reporting of suspicions in the area of privacy," according to Reuters.

zhs: 律师克里斯蒂安·谢尔兹 (Christian Schertz ) 表示罗纳尔多将要求赔偿“与侵犯行为的严重程度相应的精神损害赔偿金额，这可能是近年来最严重的侵犯人权案例”。
en: Lawyer Christian Schertz said the player would seek compensation for "moral damages in an amount corresponding to the gravity of the infringement, which is probably one of the most serious violations of personal rights in recent years."

zhs: 据称，指称事件发生在 2009 年 6 月，拉斯维加斯棕榈树赌场度假酒店 (Palms Hotel and Casino) 的一间套房内。
en: The alleged incident is said to have taken place in June 2009 at a suite at the Palms Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.

zhs: 据内华达州克拉克县地方法院的文件显示，罗纳尔多和马约尔加在一家夜店见面后，报道称二人回到了球员的房间，在那里发生了强奸事件。
en: After meeting in a nightclub, Ronaldo and Mayorga reportedly went back to the player's room, where he allegedly anally raped her, according to papers filed at Clark County District Court in Nevada.

zhs: 马约尔加称，罗纳尔多在指称事件发生后下跪对她说，自己“99%”的时候都是“绅士”，而如今却被那“1%”拖下水。
en: Mayorga claims Ronaldo fell to his knees after the alleged incident and told her he was "99 percent" a "good guy" let down by the "one percent."

zhs: 文件指出罗纳尔多承认二人发生性关系，但是双方自愿的。
en: The documents claim that Ronaldo confirmed the pair had sex, but that it was consensual.

zhs: 马约尔加还表示，她去了警察局，在医院拍下了自己受伤的照片，但后来却同意了庭外和解，因为她“害怕遭到报复”，担心“受到公开羞辱”。
en: Mayorga also claims she went to the police and had photographs taken of her injuries at a hospital, but later agreed to an out-of-court settlement because she felt "terrified of retaliation" and was worried about "being publicly humiliated."

zhs: 34 岁的马约尔加称，由于因指称事件影响持续受到精神创伤，因此目前她正寻求推翻庭外和解。
en: The 34-year-old says she is now seeking to overturn the settlement as she continues to be traumatized by the alleged incident.

zhs: 指称案件发生时，罗纳尔多即将从曼联加盟皇马，而今年夏天罗纳尔多已经以 1 亿欧元入会费加入意大利豪门尤文图斯。
en: Ronaldo was on the verge of joining Real Madrid from Manchester United at the time of the alleged assault, and this summer moved to Italian giants Juve in a €100 million deal.

zhs: 脱欧：英国失去汽车制造商“成为其永远的遗憾”
en: Brexit: UK 'would forever regret' losing carmakers

zhs: 英国商务大臣格雷格·克拉克 (Greg Clark) 表示，英国脱欧后，失去其汽车制造业全球领导者的地位，将“成为其永远的遗憾”。
en: The UK "would regret it forever" if it lost its status as a world leader in car manufacturing after Brexit, Business Secretary Greg Clark has said.

zhs: 他补充道，英国丰田工厂向 BBC 介绍称，如果英国在没有达成协议的情况下退出欧盟，则丰田将暂时停止德比附近的伯纳斯顿工厂的生产。
en: He added it was "concerning" that Toyota UK had told the BBC that if Britain left the EU without a deal it would temporarily halt production at its factory in Burnaston, near Derby.

zhs: “我们需要一份协议”，克拉克先生说道。
en: "We need a deal," Mr Clark said.

zhs: 这家日本汽车制造商表示，英国在没有达成一致的情况下脱欧，边境延误问题可能会导致就业机会减少。
en: The Japanese carmaker said the impact of border delays in the event of a no-deal Brexit could cost jobs.

zhs: 伯纳斯顿工厂负责制造丰田的 Auris 和 Avensis，去年生产了近 15 万辆汽车，其中 90％ 出口到了其他欧盟国家。
en: The Burnaston plant - which makes Toyota's Auris and Avensis - produced nearly 150,000 cars last year of which 90% were exported to the rest of the European Union.

zhs: “我的观点是，如果英国在 3 月底退出欧盟，我们的工厂将停止生产”，丰田公司伯纳斯顿工厂董事总经理马文·库克 (Marvin Cooke) 介绍道。
en: "My view is that if Britain crashes out of the EU at the end of March we will see production stops in our factory," said Marvin Cooke, Toyota's managing director at Burnaston.

zhs: 其他英国汽车制造商，包括本田、宝马和捷豹路虎同样表示，如果在英国脱欧后跨境贸易运作的问题上未达成协议的情况下，担心会出什么问题。
en: Other UK car manufacturers have raised fears about leaving the EU without agreement on how cross-border trade will function, including Honda, BMW and Jaguar Land Rover.

zhs: 例如，宝马表示，将在英国脱欧后，将位于牛津的迷你工厂关闭一个月。
en: BMW, for example, says it will close its Mini plant in Oxford for a month following Brexit.

zhs: 汽车制造商主要的担心是未达成协议的情况下脱欧，可能存在供应链风险。
en: The main concerns relate to what carmakers say are supply chain risks in the event of a no-deal Brexit.

zhs: 丰田生产线的运行基础为“准时制”，每 37 分钟便会收到从英国和欧盟的供应商下达的汽车订单。
en: Toyota's production line is run on a "just-in-time" basis, with parts arriving every 37 minutes from suppliers in both the UK and the EU for cars made to order.

zhs: 如果在 3 月 29 日，英国在没有达成协议的情况下便退出欧盟，那么英国的边境可能会出现中断问题，业内人士称，这可能会导致部件延迟和短缺。
en: If the UK leaves the EU without a deal on 29 March, there could be disruption at the border which the industry says could lead to delays and shortages of parts.

zhs: 该公司表示，德比郡的丰田工厂无法持有超过一天的库存，因此生产将停止。
en: It would be impossible for Toyota to hold more than a day's worth of inventory at its Derbyshire plant, the company said, and so production would be stopped.

zhs: 克拉克先生表示，特雷莎·梅 (Theresa May) 针对未来与欧盟的关系所提出的契克斯计划 (Chequers plan) “经过准确核对，能避免边境检查”。
en: Mr Clark said Theresa May's Chequers plan for future relations with the EU is "precisely calibrated to avoid those checks at the border."

zhs: “我们需要达成协议。我们希望达成最圆满的协议，既能实现目前的成功，也能让我们抓住这个机会“，他向 BBC 广播电台的《4's Today》节目这样介绍道。
en: "We need to have a deal. We want to have the best deal that will allow as I say not just the success at present to be enjoyed but for us to grasp this opportunity," he told BBC Radio 4's Today programme.

zhs: “丰田和其他制造商的证据表明，我们需要绝对的能力，继续推动一系列成效显著的供应链。”
en: "The evidence from not just Toyota but other manufacturers is that we need to absolutely be able to continue what has been a highly successful set of supply chains."

zhs: 丰田未表示会停产多久，但从长远来看，成本的增长将削弱工厂的竞争力并最终影响工作机会。
en: Toyota was unable to say how long production would be stopped, but in the longer term, warned that added costs would reduce the plant's competitiveness and eventually cost jobs.

zhs: Peter Bouvallaris 已在伯纳斯顿工厂工作了 24 年，现任是工厂的联合召集人，他表示，他的成员越来越担心：“根据我的经验来看，一旦丢了这些工作，就再也回不来了。
en: Peter Tsouvallaris, who has worked at Burnaston for 24 years and is the Unite union convenor at the plant, said his members are increasingly concerned: "In my experience once these jobs go they never come back.

zhs: 一位政府发言人介绍称：“对于未来与欧盟的关系，我们已经制定了精确可靠的计划。”
en: A government spokesperson said: "We have put forward a precise and credible plan for our future relationship with the EU."

zhs: 白宫称，特朗普与罗森斯坦的会面可能会再次推迟
en: Trump meeting with Rosenstein may be delayed again, says White House

zhs: 白宫周日表示，由于最高法院候选人布雷特卡瓦诺的风波尚未平息，唐纳德·特朗普与司法部副部长罗德·罗森斯坦 (Rod Rosenstein) 的高端会议可能会“推迟一周”。
en: Donald Trump's high-stakes meeting with deputy attorney general Rod Rosenstein could be "pushed back another week" as the fight over supreme court nominee Brett Kavanaugh continues, the White House said on Sunday.

zhs: 罗森斯坦负责监督特别顾问罗伯特·穆勒 (Robert Mueller) 的工作，而罗伯特·穆勒特朗普竞选团队被控私通俄罗斯案以及总统可能妨碍司法公正的调查。
en: Rosenstein oversees the work of special counsel Robert Mueller, who is investigating Russian election interference, links between Trump aides and Russia and potential obstruction of justice by the president.

zhs: 特朗普是否会解雇司法部副部长，从而危及穆勒的独立，几个月以来，华盛顿对此议论纷纷。
en: Whether or not Trump will fire the deputy attorney general, and thereby endanger Mueller's independence, has fuelled Washington gossip for months.

zhs: 本月初，《纽约时报》报道称，罗森斯坦曾讨论，佩戴窃听器记录与特朗普的谈话，以及是否有可能通过第 25 次修正案罢免这位总统。
en: Earlier this month, the New York Times reported that Rosenstein discussed wearing a wire to record conversations with Trump and the possibility of removing the president via the 25th amendment.

zhs: 罗森斯坦对这一报道予以否认。
en: Rosenstein denied the report.

zhs: 但上周一，在铺天盖地的称其即将辞职的报道中，他前往了白宫。
en: But last Monday he went to the White House, amid reports he was about to resign.

zhs: 周四，有消息宣布称他与当时在纽约联合国的特朗普进行了会面。
en: Instead, a meeting with Trump, who was then at the United Nations in New York, was announced for Thursday.

zhs: 特朗普表示，他“不愿意”解雇罗森斯坦，但随后推迟了会议，这是为了避免与参议院司法委员会的听证会发生冲突，卡瓦诺和一名指控其性行为不端的女性克里斯蒂娜·布拉西·福特博士将出席听证会发表证词。
en: Trump said he would "prefer not" to fire Rosenstein but then the meeting was delayed to avoid a clash with the Senate judiciary committee hearing in which Kavanaugh and one of the women who have accused him of sexual misconduct, Dr Christine Blasey Ford, both testified.

zhs: 周五，特朗普下令联邦调查局对卡瓦诺进行为期一周的调查，又将参议院的全面投票延后。
en: On Friday, Trump ordered a one-week FBI investigation of claims against Kavanaugh, further delaying a full Senate vote.

zhs: 特朗普的新闻秘书萨拉·桑德斯 (Sarah Sanders) 周日现身 Fox News。
en: Trump's press secretary, Sarah Sanders, appeared on Fox News Sunday.

zhs: 当被问及罗森斯坦会面的问题时，她说道：“鉴于最高法院正在进行的所有其他事情，可能会推迟一周，具体日期还没有确定，我想，可能是本周。”
en: Asked about the Rosenstein meeting, she said: "A date for that hasn't been set, it could be this week, I could see that pushing back another week given all of the other things that are going on with the supreme court.

zhs: 但是我们会看到这一天的，我会随时告知媒体相关进展。”
en: But we'll see and I always like to keep the press updated."

zhs: 一些记者会对这种说法进行反驳：桑德斯自 9 月 10 日以来，一直没有在举行过白宫新闻发布会。
en: Some reporters would contest that assertion: Sanders has not held a White House press briefing since 10 September.

zhs: 主持人克里斯·华莱士 (Chris Wallace) 问这是为什么。
en: Host Chris Wallace asked why.

zhs: 桑德斯说，没举行新闻发布会并不是因为讨厌电视记者的“哗众取宠”，尽管她说道：“我不会反对他们哗众取宠的报道。”
en: Sanders said the scarcity of briefings was not due to a distaste for TV reporters "grandstanding," although she said: "I won't disagree with the fact that they grandstand."

zhs: 她随后表示，将会增加特朗普与媒体之间的直接接触。
en: She then suggested direct contact between Trump and the press will increase.

zhs: 她说：“特朗普总统的问答环节比以往任何一位总统都多。”不过，她并未援引任何证据。“我们研究过这些数字。”
en: "The president does more Q&A sessions than any president has prior to him," she said, adding without citing evidence: "We've looked at those numbers."

zhs: 桑德斯说，仍会举行新闻发布会，但“如果媒体有机会直接向美国总统提问，那要比跟我交谈好得多。”
en: Briefings will still happen, Sanders said, but "if the press has the chance to ask the president of the United States questions directly, that's infinitely better than talking to me.

zhs: 我们尽量多组织这样的问答，过去几周也确实组织了好多次，当大家可以直接与美国总统对话后，便会取消新闻发布会。
en: We try to do that a lot and you've seen us do that a lot over the last few weeks and that's going to take the place of a press briefing when you can talk to the president of the United States."

zhs: 特朗普在离开白宫或参加与来访政要的公开会议或新闻发布会时，经常会设置问答环节。
en: Trump regularly takes questions when leaving the White House or participating in open sessions or press conferences with visiting dignitaries.

zhs: 单独进行的新闻发布会很少。
en: Solo press conferences are rare.

zhs: 本周在纽约，总统或许向我们说明了这背后的原因，毫无顾忌地出现在聚集的记者面前，有时甚至表现得很奇怪。
en: In New York this week the president perhaps demonstrated why, making a freewheeling and at times bizarre appearance before gathered reporters.

zhs: 卫生部长就英国脱欧的担忧致信苏格兰国家医疗服务体系 (NHS) 的欧盟工作人员
en: Health secretary writes to EU workers at NHS Scotland over Brexit fears

zhs: 卫生部长致信苏格兰国家医疗服务体系 (NHS) 的欧盟工作人员，表达国家对他们的感激之情，并希望他们在英国脱欧后继续留在苏格兰。
en: The Health Secretary has written to EU staff working in Scotland's NHS to express the country's gratitude and wish for them to stay on post-Brexit.

zhs: 医疗服务计划 (MSP) 的珍妮·弗里曼 (Jeane Freeman) 曾在英国退出欧盟前六个月内发出一份信函。
en: Jeane Freeman MSP sent a letter with less than six months to go until the UK withdraws from the EU.

zhs: 苏格兰政府已经承诺为在其移交的公共服务部门工作的欧盟公民支付定居身份申请的费用。
en: The Scottish Government has already committed to meet the cost of settled status applications for EU citizens working in its devolved public services.

zhs: 在信中，弗里曼写道：“英国和欧盟之间关于脱欧的谈判一直持续了整个夏天，有望在今年秋天做出决定。
en: In her letter, Ms Freeman wrote: "Over the summer, negotiations between the UK and EU on withdrawal have continued, heading towards expected decisions this autumn.

zhs: 但是英国政府也在加紧为可能出现的无协议局面做准备。
en: But the UK Government has also been stepping up its preparations for a possible no-deal scenario.

zhs: 我知道这段时间对你们来说一定感觉非常不安。
en: I know this must be a very unsettling time for all of you.

zhs: 因此，我想重申我是多么重视每一名工作人员的贡献，无论你们的国籍如何。
en: That is why I wanted to reiterate now how much I value the contribution of every member of staff, regardless of their nationality.

zhs: 欧盟内外的同事们提供的宝贵经验和技能，将加强和改进我们的医疗服务工作，造福我们所服务的患者和社区。
en: Colleagues from across the EU, and beyond, bring valuable experience and skills that strengthen and improve the work of the health service, and benefit the patients and communities we serve.

zhs: 苏格兰永远是你们的家，我们非常希望你们能留在这里。”
en: Scotland is absolutely your home and we very much want you to stay here."

zhs: Christion Abercrombie 头部受伤后接受紧急手术
en: Christion Abercrombie Undergoes Emergency Surgery After Suffering Head Injury

zhs: 田纳西州的 Mike Organ 报道称，田纳西州立大学猛虎队 (Tennessee State Tigers) 于周六以31-27击败范德比尔特大学海军准将队 (Vanderbilt Commodores)，比赛中，猛虎队后卫球员克里斯蒂安·阿伯克龙比 (Christion Abercrombie) 头部受伤，随后接受了紧急手术。
en: Tennessee State Tigers linebacker Christion Abercrombie underwent emergency surgery after suffering a head injury in Saturday's 31-27 defeat to the Vanderbilt Commodores, the Tennessean's Mike Organ reported.

zhs: 田纳西州立大学猛虎队主教练罗德·里德 (Rod Reed) 向记者介绍称，阿伯克龙比是在半场结束前不久受的伤。
en: Tennessee State head coach Rod Reed told reporters the injury happened shortly before halftime.

zhs: “他跑到边线，然后突然就倒下了”，里德介绍称。
en: "He came to the sideline and just kind of collapsed there," Reed said.

zhs: 培训师和医务人员在边线旁给阿伯克龙比输了氧气，然后将他抬到担架上，带回来进行进一步评估。
en: Trainers and medical personnel gave Abercrombie oxygen on the sideline before placing him on a stretcher and taking him back for further evaluation.

zhs: 田纳西州立大学猛虎队的一位官方人员向田纳西州纳什维尔 WSMV 新闻的克里斯·哈里斯透露称，阿伯克龙比已在范德比尔特医疗中心 (Vanderbilt Medical Center) 完成手术。
en: An official from Tennessee State told Chris Harris of WSMV in Nashville, Tennessee, that Abercrombie was out of surgery at Vanderbilt Medical Center.

zhs: 哈里斯补充道，“目前尚未确定损伤的类型/程度”，而田纳西州立大学猛虎队正在努力了解受伤的具体时间。
en: Harris added that there are "no details on type/extent of injury yet" and Tennessee State is trying to figure out when the injury occurred.

zhs: 阿伯克龙比是一名大学二年级的红衫球员学生，这是他从伊利诺伊州转学来到这里后，在田纳西州立大学的第一个赛季。
en: Abercrombie, a redshirt sophomore, is in his first season with Tennessee State after transferring from Illinois.

zhs: 在周六的比赛中，退出比赛前，他共完成 5 次铲球，从而将其赛季铲球总数提高到了 18 次。
en: He had five total tackles Saturday before exiting the game, which brought his season total to 18 tackles.

zhs: 对在英国买房的外国买家加收更高的印花税
en: Foreign buyers will be charged higher stamp duty when they buy a property in the UK

zhs: 根据新推出的保守党计划，英国将对在英国购买房产的外国买家加收印花税，所取得的税款将用于帮助应对无家可归的问题
en: Foreign buyers will be charged higher stamp duty when they buy a property in the UK with the extra cash used to help the homeless under new Tory plans

zhs: 此举将抵消科尔宾 (Corbyn) 在吸引年轻选民方面所取得的成功
en: The move will neutralise the success of Corbyn's drive to attract young voters

zhs: 加收印花税针对的是在英国不纳税的人群
en: The stamp duty rise will be levied on those who are not paying tax in the UK

zhs: 财政部预计，每年将筹资1.2 亿英镑，帮助无家可归者
en: The Treasury expects it raise up to £120 million a year- to help the homeless

zhs: 特雷莎·梅 (Theresa May) 将于今日宣布，外国买家在英国购买房产时将被征收更高的印花税，加收所得税费将用于帮助无家可归者。
en: Foreign buyers are set to be charged a higher stamp duty rate when they buy property in the UK - with the extra cash used to help the homeless, Theresa May will announce today.

zhs: 此举还承诺提供更多经济适用房，锁定高收入人群。这一举动还被视为是为了抵消杰里米·科尔宾 (Jeremy Corbyn) 在吸引年轻选民方面所取得的成功。
en: The move will be seen as an attempt to neutralise the success of Jeremy Corbyn's drive to attract young voters with pledges to provide more affordable housing and target high earners.

zhs: 加收印花税针对的是在英国不纳税的个人和公司，额外取得的资金将用于改善政府对露宿问题的解决。
en: The stamp duty rise will be levied on individuals and firms not paying tax in the UK, with the extra money boosting the Government's drive to combat rough sleeping.

zhs: 除了目前的印花税，包括两年前推出的第二套住房与买房租赁增税，附加费可能高达 3％。
en: The surcharge - which is in addition to the present stamp duty, including the higher levels introduced two years ago on second homes and buy-to-lets - could be as much as three per cent.

zhs: 财政部预计，每年将筹资1.2 亿英镑。
en: The Treasury expects the move to raise up to £120 million a year.

zhs: 据估计，13％ 的新建伦敦房产的购买者为非英国居民，这抬高了价格，使首次购房者的买房之路难上加难。
en: An estimated 13 per cent of new-build London properties are bought by non-UK residents, driving up prices and making it harder for first-time buyers to get a foot on the housing ladder.

zhs: 英国许多富裕地区，尤其是伦敦，已经成了“鬼城”，因为大量外国购房者大部分时间都不在英国。
en: Many wealthy areas of the country - particularly in the capital - have become "ghost towns" because of the high number of foreign buyers who spend most of their time out of the country.

zhs: 就在这项新政策推出前，鲍里斯·约翰逊 (Boris Johnson) 呼吁减少印花税，让更多年轻人能购买第一套房产。
en: The new policy comes just weeks after Boris Johnson called for a stamp duty cut to help more young people own their first home.

zhs: 他指责大型建筑公司通过抢购土地，而不是使用土地，来维持房价的高水平，并力劝梅女士放弃对经济适用房的配额，解决英国的“住房耻辱”。
en: He accused big construction firms of keeping property prices high by snapping up land but not using it, and urged Mrs May to abandon quotas on affordable homes to fix Britain's "housing disgrace."

zhs: 科尔宾先生宣布了一系列住房改革建议，博得了众多眼球，包括租金管制和结束“无过错”的搬迁。
en: Mr Corbyn has announced an eye-catching series of proposed housing reforms, including rent controls and an end to "no-fault" evictions.

zhs: 他还希望，赋予议会更大的权力来建造新的房屋。
en: He also wants to give councils greater powers to build new homes.

zhs: 梅女士称：“去年我说过，我会在任职首相期间，恢复英国人的梦想，让每个新生代的生活都变得更好。
en: Mrs May said: "Last year I said I would dedicate my premiership to restoring the British dream - that life should be better for each new generation.

zhs: 这意味着，要修复支离破碎的住房市场。
en: And that means fixing our broken housing market.

zhs: 英国将永远欢迎那些想在这里生活、工作和建立家庭的人。
en: Britain will always be open to people who want to live, work and build a life here.

zhs: 然而，对于不住在英国的个人以及外国公司来说，与勤劳的英国居民在购房难度上别无二致，这是不对的。
en: However, it cannot be right that it is as easy for individuals who don't live in the UK, as well as foreign-based companies, to buy homes as hard-working British residents.

zhs: 对于太多人来说，拥有房屋的梦想太遥不可及，露宿的侮辱仍然非常真实。“
en: For too many people the dream of home ownership has become all too distant, and the indignity of rough sleeping remains all too real."

zhs: Jack Ross：“我最终的理想是成为苏格兰教练”
en: Jack Ross: 'My ultimate ambition is to manage Scotland'

zhs: 桑德兰队主教练杰克·罗斯 (Jack Ross) 称，自己的“最终理想”是有一天成为苏格兰主教练。
en: Sunderland boss Jack Ross says his "ultimate ambition" is to become the Scotland manager at some stage.

zhs: 这位 42 岁的苏格兰人，在设法振兴这家东北部球队，当前，这支球队的联赛排名为第三，比第一名落后 3分。
en: The Scot, 42, is relishing the challenge of reviving the North-East club, who currently sit third place in League One, three points off the top.

zhs: 在上个赛季带领圣米伦队 (St Mirren) 回到苏格兰联赛后，今年夏天，又调到了光明球场 (Stadium of Light)。
en: He moved to the Stadium of Light this summer after guiding St Mirren back to the Scottish Premiership last season.

zhs: “我想以一名球员的身份，为我的祖国效力。
en: "I wanted to play for my country as a player.

zhs: 我得到了一顶 B 帽，就是这样”。罗斯想 BBC 的苏格兰体育之声 (Sportsound) 节目介绍道。
en: I got a B cap and that was it," Ross told BBC Scotland's Sportsound.

zhs: “我是看着苏格兰队的比赛长大的，小时候经常和爸爸一起在汉普顿看比赛，我总是会会想起那段时日。
en: "But I grew up watching Scotland at Hampden a lot with my dad as a kid, and it is always something that has drawn me back.

zhs: 但只有我把球队带得很成功，我才会有这样的机会。”
en: That opportunity would only come, though, if I am successful in club management."

zhs: 在罗斯之前，担任过桑德兰队主教练的人员包括 Dick Advocaat、David Moyes、Sam Allardyce、Martin O'Neill、Roy Keane、Gus Poyet 以及 Paulo Di Canio。
en: Ross's predecessors as Sunderland manager include Dick Advocaat, David Moyes, Sam Allardyce, Martin O'Neill, Roy Keane, Gus Poyet and Paulo Di Canio.

zhs: 这位前阿罗体育队 (Alloa Athletic) 的老板说道，在这么大的俱乐部，前有这么多知名的人物，自己并不觉得害怕，之前他曾拒绝了巴恩斯利队 (Barnsley) 和奇城队 (Ipswich Town) 的邀请。
en: The former Alloa Athletic boss says he felt no trepidation in following such established names at such a big club, having previously rejected overtures from Barnsley and Ipswich Town.

zhs: “我现在的成功与否取决于‘我能否带领球队重返英超？’
en: "Success for me at the moment will be gauged by 'can I return this club to the Premier League?'

zhs: 由于这支球队的结构和设施，肯定能打入英超”，他说道。
en: Because of the structure and facilities at this club, it undoubtedly belongs in the Premier League," he said.

zhs: “这个任务并不容易，但我只有带领球队重返英超，我才可能会觉得自己算得上成功了。”
en: "It is not an easy task to get it there, but I would probably only view myself as being successful here if I can get the club back there."

zhs: 算起来，他的主教生涯才刚刚开始三年。罗斯在登巴顿当过一段时间的助理教练，并在红心队的教练组工作过 15个月。
en: Ross is only three years into his management career, after a period as assistant boss at Dumbarton and a 15-month spell on Hearts' coaching staff.

zhs: 之后，他带领阿罗从降级走到了第三梯队，在接下来的赛季，又带领圣米伦队从降级的边缘转变为总冠军。
en: He then helped Alloa recover from relegation to the third tier, and transformed St Mirren from the brink of relegation to Championship title winners the following season.

zhs: 罗斯说，比起之前在克莱德 (Clyde)、哈特尔普尔 (Hartlepool)、福尔柯克 (Falkirk)、圣米伦队和汉密尔顿学院 (Hamilton Academical) 球队的职业生涯，现在感觉更加舒服。
en: And Ross says he feels more comfortable now than he ever did during his playing career at Clyde, Hartlepool, Falkirk, St Mirren and Hamilton Academical.

zhs: 回忆起在阿罗队的经历，他说道：“这可能是一个真正的十字路口。
en: "It was probably a real crossroads," he recalled, of taking charge of Alloa.

zhs: 我真心觉得，我更适合做教练，比踢球更适合我。
en: "I genuinely did believe management was the right fit for me, more so than playing.

zhs: 这听起来很奇怪，因为我表现得还不错，靠这个生活也没什么问题，也确实有很多乐趣。
en: It sounds bizarre because I did okay, made a reasonable living out of it, and enjoyed some reasonable highs.

zhs: 但是踢球有时会很艰难。
en: But playing can be tough.

zhs: 每周都有很多事情要做。
en: There are a lot of things you have to get through on a weekly basis.

zhs: 我还是会感到踢球的压力，但做教练的我，感觉不错。
en: I still go through that in terms of the stresses and pressure of the job but management just feels right.

zhs: “我一直想做一名教练，现在我做到了，这是我成年以来，感觉最舒服的日子。”
en: I always wanted to manage and now I am doing it, it feels the most comfortable I have been in my own skin throughout my entire adult life."

zhs: 您可以在英国夏令时 9 月 30 日（星期日）12:00 至 13:00，在苏格兰广播电台 (Radio Scotland) 收听体育之声的完整采访内容
en: You can listen to the full interview on Sportsound on Sunday, 30 September, on Radio Scotland between 12:00 and 13:00 BST

zhs: 调查发现，周六的下午 5:30，最适合来杯清爽的酒水
en: Perfect time for a pint is 5.30pm on a Saturday, survey finds

zhs: 夏季的酷暑，英国苦苦挣扎的酒吧创收，连锁餐厅压力重重。
en: The summer heatwave has boosted takings for Britain's struggling pubs but heaped more pressure on restaurant chains.

zhs: 数据显示，7 月份，酒吧销售额增长了 2.7％，而餐馆的收入下降了 4.8％。
en: Pub and bar groups saw sales rise 2.7 per cent in July - but takings in restaurants were down 4.8 per cent, figures revealed.

zhs: 商业咨询公司 CGA 的彼得·马丁 (Peter Martin) 表示：“连日的酷暑，加之英格兰世界杯比赛时间超过预期，让 7 月重蹈 6 月的覆辙（6 月期间，酒吧收入增长了 2.8％），餐厅受到了更强的冲击。
en: Peter Martin, of business consultancy CGA, which compiled the figures, said: "Continued sunshine and England's longer than expected participation in the World Cup meant July followed a similar pattern to the previous month of June, when pubs were up 2.8 per cent, except that restaurants were hit even harder.

zhs: 6 月份餐厅交易量下降了 1.8％，而 7 月份，下降幅度更大。
en: The fall of 1.8 per cent in restaurant trading in June just got worse in July.

zhs: 酒水饮料为主的酒吧表现最佳，同比之下，餐厅的交易量却持续下降。
en: Drink-led pubs and bars performed by far the strongest with like-for-likes up more than restaurants were down.

zhs: 用餐为主的酒吧也受到了酷暑的影响，虽然相比餐馆经营者而言，影响相对较小。
en: Food-led pubs also suffered in the sun, although not as dramatically as the restaurant operators.

zhs: 人们似乎只是想到外面喝点什么。
en: It seems people just wanted to go out for a drink.

zhs: 整个酒吧行业本月的酒水销售额增长了 6.6％，食品销售额下降了 3％。”
en: Across managed pubs and bars drink sales were up 6.6 per cent for the month, with food down three per cent."

zhs: 休闲和酒店业分析师保罗·纽曼 (Paul Newman) 表示：“自 4 月底以来，便开始延续这一趋势。
en: Paul Newman, of leisure and hospitality analysts RSM said: "These results continue the trend we've seen since the end of April.

zhs: 影响外出消费市场销售额的主要因素中，最大的因素当属天气以及重要社会活动或体育赛事。
en: Weather and the impact of major social or sporting events remain the biggest factors when it comes to sales in the out-of-home market.

zhs: 餐饮业的持续苦苦挣扎，不足为奇，相比于销售额同比下降 4.8％，更为头疼的是持续加剧的成本压力。
en: It comes as no surprise that restaurant groups continue to struggle, albeit a sales drop of 4.8 per cent year-on-year will be particularly painful on top of ongoing cost pressures.

zhs: 对于以用餐为主的运营商而言，漫长炎热的夏天的影响可谓晴天霹雳，时间会告诉我们，8 月份气温适中的天气，能否带来必要的喘息时间。
en: The long hot summer could not have come at a worse time for food-led operators and time will tell whether the more moderate temperatures we've experienced in August will provide some much-needed respite."

zhs: 整个酒吧和餐馆行业（包括新开业的酒吧和餐馆），7 月份的总销售额增长了 2.7％，从中可见品牌推广的速度放缓。
en: Total sales growth across pub and restaurants, including new openings, was 2.7 per cent in July, reflecting the slow down in brand roll-outs.

zhs: 英国酒吧和餐馆行业监测机构 Coffer Peach Tracker 收集并分析了 47 家经营团体的业绩数据，总营业额超过 90 亿英镑，为业界确立了基准。
en: The Coffer Peach Tracker industry sales monitor for the UK pub, bar and restaurant sector collects and analyses performance data from 47 operating groups, with a combined turnover of over £9 billion, and is the established industry benchmark.

zhs: 五分之一的未成年人瞒着家长，秘密使用社交媒体
en: One in five children have secret social media accounts that they hide from their parents

zhs: 调查显示，五分之一的未成年人（小至 11 岁）瞒着家长和老师，秘密使用社交媒体
en: One in five children - some as young as 11 - have secret social media accounts that they hide from their parents and teachers, survey reveals

zhs: 一项针对 2 万名中学生的调查显示，“假 Insta”页面的使用增长
en: Survey of 20,000 secondary school pupils revealed growth in "fake Insta" pages

zhs: 这一消息引发了人们对发布色情内容的担忧
en: The news has heightened fears that sexual content is being posted

zhs: 百分之二十的学生表示自己有一个“主要”帐号，用来应付家长
en: Twenty per cent of pupils said they have a "main" account to show parents

zhs: 五分之一的未成年人（小至 11 岁）瞒着成年人，使用社交媒体。
en: One in five children - some as young as 11 - are creating social media accounts that they keep secret from adults.

zhs: 一项针对 2 万名中学生的调查显示，“假 Insta”（指的是图片共享网站 Instagram）帐号的使用迅速增长。
en: A survey of 20,000 secondary school pupils revealed a rapid growth in "fake Insta" accounts - a reference to photo-sharing site Instagram.

zhs: 这一消息引发了人们对发布色情内容的担忧。
en: The news has heightened fears that sexual content is being posted.

zhs: 百分之二十的学生表示自己有一个“净化的”主要帐号，用来应付家长，同时还有其他秘密帐号。
en: Twenty per cent of pupils said they operate a sanitised "main" account to show parents, while also having private ones.

zhs: 一位母亲偶然发现了 13 岁女儿的秘密网站，她发现一名青少年鼓励其他人“强奸我”。
en: One mother who stumbled across her 13-year-old's daughter's secret site found a teenager urging others to "rape me."

zhs: 该调查由由英国数字意识 (Digital Awareness UK) 和校长联合会 (Headmasters" and Headmistresses" Conference, HMC) 共同发起，调查发现 40% 的 11-18 岁未成年人同时拥有两个帐号，其中有一半的未成年人承认拥有秘密帐号。
en: The research, by Digital Awareness UK and the Headmasters" and Headmistresses" Conference (HMC) of independent schools, found 40 per cent of 11 to 18-year-olds had two profiles, with half of those admitting to keeping private accounts.

zhs: HMC 主管 Mike Buchanan 介绍称：“这么多青少年创建网络空间，藏身其中，而家长和老师都都不知情，这着实令人不安”。
en: HMC chief Mike Buchanan said: "It's disturbing so many teenagers are tempted into creating online spaces where parents and teachers cannot find them."

zhs: 埃里德·道尔 (Eilidh Doyle) 将加入苏格兰田径委员会，担任“运动员们的代言人”
en: Eilidh Doyle will be "voice for athletes" on Scottish Athletics board

zhs: 埃里德·道尔 (Eilidh Doyle) 在政府机构的年度全体大会上被选为苏格兰田径委员会的非执行董事。
en: Eilidh Doyle has been elected to the board of Scottish Athletics as a non-executive director at the governing body's annual general meeting.

zhs: 道尔是苏格兰获得殊荣最多的田径运动员，委员会主席伊恩·贝蒂 (Ian Beattie) 称此举是田径运动教练员们向国际水平的丰富经验取经的大好机会。
en: Doyle is Scotland's most decorated track and field athlete and chairman Ian Beattie described the move as a great opportunity for those guiding the sport to benefit from her wide-ranging experience at international level over the past decade.

zhs: “埃里德在苏格兰、英国和世界体育界都享有盛誉，我们相信，如果他加入委员会，苏格兰的田径运动定会受益匪浅”，贝蒂说到。
en: "Eilidh has massive respect across the Scottish, UK and world athletics community and we are sure athletics in Scotland would benefit hugely by bringing her on to the board," Beattie said.

zhs: 道尔表示：“我很愿意成为运动员们的代言人，我希望能够为苏格兰的体育事业做出真正的贡献，并帮助提供指导。”
en: Doyle said: "I am keen to act as a voice for athletes and I am hoping I can really contribute and help guide the sport in Scotland."

zhs: 这位美国运动员共获得过四枚奥运金牌，其中 1996 年在亚特兰大奥运会上一举夺得 200 米和 400 米金牌，目前担任英国广播公司 (BBC) 的长邀评论员，在遭遇一次短暂性脑缺血发作后便无法行走。
en: The American, who won the 200 metres and 400 metres at the 1996 Games in Atlanta among his total of four Olympic golds and is now a regular BBC pundit, was left unable to walk after suffering a transient ischemic attack.

zhs: 他在推特上写道：一个月前的今天，我发生了中风。
en: He wrote on Twitter: "A month ago today I suffered a stroke.

zhs: 无法行走。
en: I could not walk.

zhs: 医生说，我能否会恢复、能恢复到什么程度，完全取决于时间。
en: Doctors said only time will tell if I will recover or to what degree.

zhs: 完全恢复、重新学习走路是一项艰巨的任务，但如今我已经能够完成敏捷性训练了！
en: Its been grueling work but made a full recovery, re-learned how to walk and today doing agility drills!

zhs: 感谢你们的鼓励！”
en: Thanks for the messages of encouragement!"

zhs: 吸奶器广告中将母亲比作奶牛惹网友争议
en: Breast pump advert comparing mothers to cows divides opinion online

zhs: 一家吸奶器公司发布的广告中，将正在哺乳的妈妈比作成挤奶的奶牛，这条广告引发了网友的分歧。
en: A breast pump company has divided opinion online with an advert that compares nursing mothers to cows being milked.

zhs: 在推出新产品“世界上第一款无声可穿戴式吸乳器”时，消费者科技公司 Elvie 发布了一条诙谐的音乐视频灵感广告，广告中展示了这种新型吸奶器给母亲带来的自由。
en: To mark the launch of what is said to be the "world's first silent wearable breast bump," consumer tech company Elvie released a tongue-in-cheek music video-inspired advert to showcase the freedom the new pump gives to expressing mothers.

zhs: 四位真实的母亲在堆满干草的奶牛棚中，跟着音乐翩翩起舞，音乐中有一部分歌词如下：“对，我亲自喂养，但你看不到尾巴”，“是不是没发现我的大奶，其实是我的乳房。”
en: Four real mothers dance in a hay-filled barn of cows to a track that includes lyrics like: "Yes, I milk myself, but you don't see no tail" and "In case you hadn't noticed these are not udders, they're my boobs."

zhs: 接下来的歌词是：“抽出来，抽出来，喂我的小宝宝，抽出来，抽出来，奶奶我的小公主。”
en: The chorus continues: "Pump it out, pump it out, I'm feeding them babies, pump it out, pump it out, I'm milking my ladies."

zhs: 但是这条广告在该公司的 Facebook 页面上发布后，在网上引起了争议。
en: However, the advert, which has been published on the firm's Facebook page, has caused controversy online.

zhs: 这条视频的观看次数为 77,000，共有数百条评论，观众的反应各异，许多人觉得，这有蔑视乳制品行业“恐怖”的嫌疑。
en: With 77,000 views and hundreds of comments, the video has received mixed reactions from viewers, with many saying it makes light of the "horrors" of the dairy industry.

zhs: “用奶牛做这个产品的广告宣传，这个决定太失误了。
en: "Very poor decision using cows to advertise this product.

zhs: 奶牛跟我们一样，需要怀孕分娩才能有奶，但不同之处在于，奶牛的婴儿在分娩后几天就会被人偷走”，一位网友写道。
en: Like us they need to get pregnant and give birth in order to produce milk, except their babies are stolen from them within days of giving birth," one wrote.

zhs: Elvie 吸乳器正好可以放在哺乳文胸 (Elvie/Mother) 内
en: The Elvie breast pump fits discreetly inside a nursing bra (Elvie/Mother)

zhs: 另一位网友评论道：“对于母亲和婴儿来说，这无疑是一种创伤。
en: Another commented: "Understandably traumatic for both mother and baby.

zhs: 为什么要在吸奶器广告中，将妈妈比做城市奶牛呢，妈妈可不希望孩子离开自己？”
en: But yeah why not use them to advertise a breast pump for mothers who get to keep their babies?"

zhs: 另有网友补充说：“这广告太不符合现实了。”
en: Someone else added: "Such an out of touch advert."

zhs: 其他人则认为广告不错，一位女士承认，她发现这首歌“很搞笑”。
en: Others defended the advert, with one woman admitting that she found the song "hilarious."

zhs: “我觉得这个创意特别新颖。
en: "I think this is a genus idea.

zhs: 如果我还在哺乳的话，我会买一个的。
en: I would've had one if I was still breastfeeding.

zhs: 吸奶的过程，让我觉得自己就是一头奶牛。
en: Pumping made me feel exactly like a cow.

zhs: 广告是有一些过头，但我觉得还好。
en: The advert is a little mad but I took it for what it was.

zhs: 这个产品很新颖。”一位网友这样写道。
en: This is a genius product," one wrote.

zhs: 另一位网友评论道：这条滑稽的广告针对的就是需要吸奶（通常是在公司或卫生间内）感觉自己像“奶牛”一样的妈妈。
en: Another commented: "This is a fun advert aimed at mums who pump (often in their workplaces or toilets) and feel like "cows."

zhs: 并不无意要赞扬或是评判乳制品行业。”
en: This is not an advert praising or judging the dairy industry."

zhs: 在视频结尾时，这群妈妈展示了自己在跳舞时，其实文胸中还穿戴了吸奶器。
en: At the end of the video the group of women reveal they've all been dancing with the discreet pumps tucked in their bras.

zhs: 这条宣传广告后的创意，来源于许多女性在吸奶的时候称自己就像是奶牛。
en: The concept behind the campaign is based on the insight that many women who breast-pump say they feel like cows.

zhs: 然而，Elvie 吸奶器完全静音，无需电线或管子，可以完美地放置于哺乳文胸内，让女性解放双手，可以抱着婴儿，甚至可以在外出时继续吸奶。
en: The Elvie Pump however, is completely silent, has no wires or tubes and fits discreetly inside a nursing bra, giving women the freedom to move, hold their babies, and even go out while pumping.

zhs: Mother 的合伙人兼执行创意总监 (ECD) Ana Balarin 评论道：“Elvie Pump 是一款革命性的产品，值得大胆尝试。
en: Ana Balarin, partner and ECD at Mother commented: "The Elvie Pump is such a revolutionary product that it deserved a bold and provocative launch.

zhs: 通过对比哺乳妈妈和奶牛，我们希望将吸奶的过程及其问题置于聚光灯下，同时以一种有趣又有关联的方式，展示这种新型吸奶器能给人带来无与伦比的自由感。
en: By drawing a parallel between expressing women and dairy cows we wanted to put breast pumping and all its challenges in the spotlight, while demonstrating in an entertaining and relatable way the incredible sense of freedom that the new pump will bring.

zhs: 这已经不是 Elvie 吸奶器首次上头条新闻。
en: This is not the first time the Elvie pump has made the headlines.

zhs: 在伦敦时装周期间，两个孩子的母亲穿着设计师 Marta Jakubowski 设计的服装登上 T 台，当时她便穿戴了这款产品。
en: During London Fashion Week, a mother of two appeared on the catwalk for designer Marta Jakubowski while using the product.

zhs: 数百名流动儿童悄悄转移至德克萨斯州边境的一处露营地
en: Hundreds of Migrant Children Quietly Moved to a Tent Camp on the Texas Border

zhs: 尽管每个月边境口岸的政策相对不会发生变化，但被扣留的流动儿童数量仍大幅上升，部分应归因于特朗普政府推行严厉的说辞和政策，增加了赞助者们安置儿童的难度。
en: The number of detained migrant children has spiked even though monthly border crossings have remained relatively unchanged, in part because harsh rhetoric and policies introduced by the Trump administration have made it harder to place children with sponsors.

zhs: 传说大多数赞助者本身都是非法移民，他们担心站出来领养儿童会危及自身留在美国的可能性。
en: Traditionally, most sponsors have been undocumented immigrants themselves, and have feared jeopardizing their own ability to remain in the country by stepping forward to claim a child.

zhs: 六月，联邦当局宣布潜在赞助者及其其他成年家庭成员必须提交指纹，并且当局将与移民局共享其指纹信息，这导致风险大大上升。
en: The risk increased in June, when federal authorities announced that potential sponsors and other adult members of their households would have to submit fingerprints, and that the data would be shared with immigration authorities.

zhs: 上周，移民和海关执法局 (Immigration and Customs Enforcement) 的高级官员马修·阿尔伯塞特 (Matthew Albence) 在国会前证实，该机构已经逮捕数十名申请赞助无成人陪伴儿童的人员。
en: Last week, Matthew Albence, a senior official with Immigration and Customs Enforcement, testified before Congress that the agency had arrested dozens of people who applied to sponsor unaccompanied minors.

zhs: 稍后，该机构证实称 70% 被逮捕的人均无犯罪前科。
en: The agency later confirmed that 70 percent of those arrested did not have prior criminal records.

zhs: “近 80% 作为赞助者或赞助者家庭成员的个人均为非法入境，其中大部分为跨国罪犯。
en: "Close to 80 percent of the individuals that are either sponsors or household members of sponsors are here in the country illegally, and a large chunk of those are criminal aliens.

zhs: 因此我们在不停地追捕这些人”，阿尔伯塞特说到。
en: So we are continuing to pursue those individuals," Mr. Albence said.

zhs: 据庇护所工作人员称，为了尽快解决这些儿童的问题，官员们推出了新的规定，要求其中一些孩子在被扣留的一个月（而不是之前规定的 60 天后）内出庭。
en: Seeking to process the children more quickly, officials introduced new rules that will require some of them to appear in court within a month of being detained, rather than after 60 days, which was the previous standard, according to shelter workers.

zhs: 很多儿童不会亲自出庭，相反，将以视频电话会议的形式出现，向移民法官就自己的合法身份进行辩护。
en: Many will appear via video conference call, rather than in person, to plead their case for legal status to an immigration judge.

zhs: 那些被认为不符合救济资格的儿童将被迅速驱逐出境。
en: Those who are deemed ineligible for relief will be swiftly deported.

zhs: 据庇护所工作人员以及近几个月该系统的报告称，儿童被扣留的时间越长，他们就越有可能变得焦虑或抑郁，从而导致产生暴力行为或逃跑企图。
en: The longer that children remain in custody, the more likely they are to become anxious or depressed, which can lead to violent outbursts or escape attempts, according to shelter workers and reports that have emerged from the system in recent months.

zhs: 辩护律师表示，在像 Tornillo 这样的大型设施中，这方面的担忧更为严重，因为这样的地方规模过于庞大，很容易忽视儿童反抗的迹象。
en: Advocates said those concerns are heightened at a larger facility like Tornillo, where signs that a child is struggling are more likely to be overlooked, because of its size.

zhs: 他们补充说，在儿童没有足够的时间在情感上做好准备，也没有足够的时间和朋友们道别的情况下，将儿童转移到帐篷城，可能会加重很多儿童本就已经遭受的创伤。
en: They added that moving children to the tent city without providing enough time to prepare them emotionally or to say goodbye to friends could compound trauma that many are already struggling with.

zhs: 叙利亚勒令美国、法国和土耳其的“占领军”立即撤离
en: Syria tells US, French and Turkish 'occupying forces' to withdraw immediately

zhs: 外交部长瓦立德·穆阿利姆 (Walid al-Moualem) 在联合国大会 (UN General Assembly) 上的发言也呼吁叙利亚难民尽快回国，尽管叙利亚战争已经持续八年。
en: Addressing the UN General Assembly, Foreign Minister Walid al-Moualem also called on Syrian refugees to come home, even though the country's war is now in its eighth year.

zhs: 同时担任叙利亚副总理的穆阿利姆表示，外国军队以打击恐怖主义为借口，非法进入叙利亚领土，“将得到相应的处理”。
en: Moualem, who also serves as deputy prime minister, said the foreign forces were on Syrian soil illegally, under the pretext of fighting terrorism, and "will be dealt with accordingly."

zhs: “他们必须立即无条件撤离”，穆阿利姆向联合国大会表示。
en: "They must withdraw immediately and without any conditions," he told the assembly.

zhs: 穆阿利姆坚持称叙利亚的“反恐战争即将结束”，自 2011 年以来战争已经导致 360,000 多人死亡，数百万人流离失所。
en: Moualem insisted that the "war on terror is almost over" in Syria, where more than 360,000 people have died since 2011, with millions more uprooted from their homes.

zhs: 他表示，大马士革方面将继续“对抗这场祭祀之战，直到我们清除叙利亚领土”上的所有恐怖组织和“所有非法外国势力。”
en: He said Damascus would continue "fighting this sacred battle until we purge all Syrian territories" of both terror groups and "any illegal foreign presence."

zhs: 美国有 2,000 多名士兵驻扎在叙利亚，主要负责为反对总统巴沙尔·阿萨德 (Bashar al-Assad) 的库尔德部队和叙利亚阿拉伯人提供培训和咨询。
en: The United States has some 2,000 troops in Syria, mainly training and advising both Kurdish forces and Syrian Arabs opposed to President Bashar al-Assad.

zhs: 法国有 1,000 多名士兵驻扎在这个战乱的国家。
en: France has more than 1,000 troops on the ground in the war-wracked country.

zhs: 对于难民问题，穆阿利姆表示条件允许他们回国，并谴责“某些西方国家”“传播非理性恐惧”迫使他们背井离乡。
en: On the issue of refugees, Moualem said the conditions were fine for them to return, and he blamed "some western countries" for "spreading irrational fears" that prompted refugees to stay away.

zhs: “我们已经呼吁国际社会和人道主义组织帮助促成难民回国”，他表示。
en: "We have called upon the international community and humanitarian organizations to facilitate these returns," he said.

zhs: “他们正在将纯粹的人道主义问题政治化”。
en: "They are politicizing what should be a purely humanitarian issue."

zhs: 美国和欧盟已经警告称，不会为叙利亚提供重建援助，直至阿萨德与反对派达成终止战争的政治协议。
en: The United States and the European Union have warned that there will be no reconstruction aid for Syria until there is a political agreement between Assad and the opposition to end the war.

zhs: 联合国 (UN) 外交官表示，俄罗斯和土耳其近期就在伊德利卜最后一个主要叛军据点建立缓冲区达成协议，此举为推进政治谈判创造了机会。
en: UN diplomats say a recent agreement between Russia and Turkey to set up a buffer zone in the last major rebel stronghold of Idlib has created an opportunity to press ahead with political talks.

zhs: 俄罗斯和土耳其之间的协议避免了俄罗斯支持的叙利亚军队对居住有三百万人口的省发起大规模进攻。
en: The Russian-Turkish deal averted a large-scale assault by Russian-backed Syrian forces on the province, where three million people live.

zhs: 然而，穆阿利姆强调，这项协议有“明确的最后期限”，并表示希望军事行动将目标指向圣战者，包括“将被根除”的与基地组织有关的努斯拉阵线的武装分子。
en: Moualem however stressed that the agreement had "clear deadlines" and expressed hope that military action will target jihadists including fighters from the Al-Qaeda-linked Nusra Front, who "will be eradicated."

zhs: 联合国特使德米苏图拉 (Staffan de Mistura) 希望由政府和反对派成员组成的新委员会尽快召开首次会议，起草叙利亚战后宪法，为选举铺平道路。
en: UN envoy Staffan de Mistura is hoping to soon convene the first meetings of a new committee comprised of government and opposition members to draft a post-war constitution for Syria and pave the way to elections.

zhs: 穆阿利姆列出了叙利亚政府加入委员会的条件，他表示，委员会的工作应该限制为“审查现行宪法的条款”，并警告不要加以干涉。
en: Moualem laid out conditions for the Syrian government's participation in the committee, saying the panel's work should be restricted "to reviewing the articles of the current constitution," and warned against interference.

zhs: 特朗普为什么会赢得连任
en: Why Trump Will Win a Second Term

zhs: 按照这种逻辑，特朗普将在 2020 年赢得连任，除非如众多自由观众所愿，弹劾和丑闻提前终止他的总统任期。
en: By that logic, Mr. Trump would win re-election in 2020 unless, as many liberal viewers are probably hoping, impeachment and scandal end his presidency prematurely.

zhs: 毫无疑问的是，“这将成为有史以来最具戏剧性的总统任期结局！”
en: In what would no doubt be "The most dramatic finale of a presidency ever!"

zhs: 但是到目前为止，人们似乎还没有出现审美疲劳的迹象。
en: As of now, there are no signs of viewer fatigue.

zhs: 自 2014 年以来，美国有线电视新闻网 (CNN) 黄金时段的收视率增长了不止一倍多，达到了 105 万，而微软全国广播电视公司 (MSNBC) 的收视率则增至三倍，达到了 160 万。
en: Since 2014, prime-time ratings have more than doubled to 1.05 million at CNN and nearly tripled to 1.6 million at MSNBC.

zhs: 尼尔森 (Nielsen) 的数据显示，福克斯新闻 (Fox News) 黄金时段的平均观众人数从四年前的 170 万上升至 240 万，而 MSNBC 的《雷切尔·玛多秀》(The Rachel Maddow Show) 凭借主要夜间新闻高达 350 万的观众人数稳居有线电视收视率榜首。
